Animation.name: Animation
Animation.description: This object represents an animation file (GIF or H.264/MPEG-4 AVC video without sound).

properties.name: duration
properties.description: Duration of the video in seconds as defined by sender

properties.name: file_id
properties.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file

properties.name: file_name
properties.description: Optional. Original animation filename as defined by sender

properties.name: file_size
properties.description: Optional. File size in bytes. It can be bigger than 2^31 and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this value.

properties.name: file_unique_id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

properties.name: height
properties.description: Video height as defined by sender

properties.name: mime_type
properties.description: Optional. MIME type of the file as defined by sender

properties.name: thumb
properties.description: Optional. Animation thumbnail as defined by sender

properties.name: width
properties.description: Video width as defined by sender

Audio.name: Audio
Audio.description: This object represents an audio file to be treated as music by the Telegram clients.

properties.name: duration
properties.description: Duration of the audio in seconds as defined by sender

properties.name: file_id
properties.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file

properties.name: file_name
properties.description: Optional. Original filename as defined by sender

properties.name: file_size
properties.description: Optional. File size in bytes. It can be bigger than 2^31 and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this value.

properties.name: file_unique_id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

properties.name: mime_type
properties.description: Optional. MIME type of the file as defined by sender

properties.name: performer
properties.description: Optional. Performer of the audio as defined by sender or by audio tags

properties.name: thumb
properties.description: Optional. Thumbnail of the album cover to which the music file belongs

properties.name: title
properties.description: Optional. Title of the audio as defined by sender or by audio tags

BotCommand.name: BotCommand
BotCommand.description: This object represents a bot command.

properties.name: command
properties.description: Text of the command; 1-32 characters. Can contain only lowercase English letters, digits and underscores.

properties.name: description
properties.description: Description of the command; 1-256 characters.

BotCommandScope.name: BotCommandScope
BotCommandScope.description:
This object represents the scope to which bot commands are applied. Currently, the following 7 scopes are supported:

- [BotCommandScopeDefault](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#botcommandscopedefault)
- [BotCommandScopeAllPrivateChats](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#botcommandscopeallprivatechats)
- [BotCommandScopeAllGroupChats](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#botcommandscopeallgroupchats)
- [BotCommandScopeAllChatAdministrators](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#botcommandscopeallchatadministrators)
- [BotCommandScopeChat](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#botcommandscopechat)
- [BotCommandScopeChatAdministrators](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#botcommandscopechatadministrators)
- [BotCommandScopeChatMember](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#botcommandscopechatmember)

BotCommandScopeAllChatAdministrators.name: BotCommandScopeAllChatAdministrators
BotCommandScopeAllChatAdministrators.description: Represents the [scope](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#botcommandscope) of bot commands, covering all group and supergroup chat administrators.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Scope type, must be all_chat_administrators

BotCommandScopeAllGroupChats.name: BotCommandScopeAllGroupChats
BotCommandScopeAllGroupChats.description: Represents the [scope](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#botcommandscope) of bot commands, covering all group and supergroup chats.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Scope type, must be all_group_chats

BotCommandScopeAllPrivateChats.name: BotCommandScopeAllPrivateChats
BotCommandScopeAllPrivateChats.description: Represents the [scope](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#botcommandscope) of bot commands, covering all private chats.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Scope type, must be all_private_chats

BotCommandScopeChat.name: BotCommandScopeChat
BotCommandScopeChat.description: Represents the [scope](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#botcommandscope) of bot commands, covering a specific chat.

properties.name: chat_id
properties.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup (in the format @supergroupusername)

properties.name: type
properties.description: Scope type, must be chat

BotCommandScopeChatAdministrators.name: BotCommandScopeChatAdministrators
BotCommandScopeChatAdministrators.description: Represents the [scope](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#botcommandscope) of bot commands, covering all administrators of a specific group or supergroup chat.

properties.name: chat_id
properties.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup (in the format @supergroupusername)

properties.name: type
properties.description: Scope type, must be chat_administrators

BotCommandScopeChatMember.name: BotCommandScopeChatMember
BotCommandScopeChatMember.description: Represents the [scope](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#botcommandscope) of bot commands, covering a specific member of a group or supergroup chat.

properties.name: chat_id
properties.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup (in the format @supergroupusername)

properties.name: type
properties.description: Scope type, must be chat_member

properties.name: user_id
properties.description: Unique identifier of the target user

BotCommandScopeDefault.name: BotCommandScopeDefault
BotCommandScopeDefault.description: Represents the default [scope](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#botcommandscope) of bot commands. Default commands are used if no commands with a [narrower scope](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#determining-list-of-commands) are specified for the user.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Scope type, must be default

CallbackGame.name: CallbackGame
CallbackGame.description: A placeholder, currently holds no information. Use [BotFather](https://web.archive.org/web/20230309033341/https://t.me/botfather) to set up your game.

CallbackQuery.name: CallbackQuery
CallbackQuery.description: This object represents an incoming callback query from a callback button in an [inline keyboard](https://core.telegram.org/web/20230309033341/https://core.telegram.org/bots/features#inline-keyboards). If the button that originated the query was attached to a message sent by the bot, the field message will be present. If the button was attached to a message sent via the bot (in [inline mode](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#inline-mode)), the field inline_message_id will be present. Exactly one of the fields data or game_short_name will be present.

properties.name: chat_instance
properties.description: Global identifier, uniquely corresponding to the chat to which the message with the callback button was sent. Useful for high scores in [games](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#games).

properties.name: data
properties.description: Optional. Data associated with the callback button. Be aware that the message originated the query can contain no callback buttons with this data.

properties.name: from
properties.description: Sender

properties.name: game_short_name
properties.description: Optional. Short name of a [Game](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#games) to be returned, serves as the unique identifier for the game

properties.name: id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this query

properties.name: inline_message_id
properties.description: Optional. Identifier of the message sent via the bot in inline mode, that originated the query.

properties.name: message
properties.description: Optional. Message with the callback button that originated the query. Note that message content and message date will not be available if the message is too old

properties.name: active_usernames
properties.description: Optional. If non-empty, the list of all [active chat usernames](https://web.archive.org/web/20230309033341/https://telegram.org/blog/topics-in-groups-collectible-usernames#collectible-usernames); for private chats, supergroups and channels. Returned only in [getChat](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#getchat).

properties.name: bio
properties.description: Optional. Bio of the other party in a private chat. Returned only in [getChat](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#getchat).

properties.name: can_set_sticker_set
properties.description: Optional. True, if the bot can change the group sticker set. Returned only in [getChat](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#getchat).

properties.name: description
properties.description: Optional. Description, for groups, supergroups and channel chats. Returned only in [getChat](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#getchat).

properties.name: emoji_status_custom_emoji_id
properties.description: Optional. Custom emoji identifier of emoji status of the other party in a private chat. Returned only in [getChat](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#getchat).

properties.name: first_name
properties.description: Optional. First name of the other party in a private chat

properties.name: has_aggressive_anti_spam_enabled
properties.description: Optional. True, if aggressive anti-spam checks are enabled in the supergroup. The field is only available to chat administrators. Returned only in [getChat](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#getchat).

properties.name: has_hidden_members
properties.description: Optional. True, if non-administrators can only get the list of bots and administrators in the chat. Returned only in [getChat](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#getchat).

properties.name: has_private_forwards
properties.description: Optional. True, if privacy settings of the other party in the private chat allows to use tg://user?id=<user_id> links only in chats with the user. Returned only in [getChat](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#getchat).

properties.name: has_protected_content
properties.description: Optional. True, if messages from the chat can't be forwarded to other chats. Returned only in [getChat](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#getchat).

properties.name: has_restricted_voice_and_video_messages
properties.description: Optional. True, if the privacy settings of the other party restrict sending voice and video note messages in the private chat. Returned only in [getChat](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#getchat).

properties.name: id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this chat. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.

properties.name: invite_link
properties.description: Optional. Primary invite link, for groups, supergroups and channel chats. Returned only in [getChat](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#getchat).

properties.name: is_forum
properties.description: Optional. True, if the supergroup chat is a forum (has [topics](https://web.archive.org/web/20230309033341/https://telegram.org/blog/topics-in-groups-collectible-usernames#topics-in-groups) enabled)

properties.name: join_by_request
properties.description: Optional. True, if all users directly joining the supergroup need to be approved by supergroup administrators. Returned only in [getChat](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#getchat).

properties.name: join_to_send_messages
properties.description: Optional. True, if users need to join the supergroup before they can send messages. Returned only in [getChat](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#getchat).

properties.name: last_name
properties.description: Optional. Last name of the other party in a private chat

properties.name: linked_chat_id
properties.description: Optional. Unique identifier for the linked chat, i.e. the discussion group identifier for a channel and vice versa; for supergroups and channel chats. This identifier may be greater than 32 bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it is smaller than 52 bits, so a signed 64 bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier. Returned only in [getChat](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#getchat).

properties.name: location
properties.description: Optional. For supergroups, the location to which the supergroup is connected. Returned only in [getChat](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#getchat).

properties.name: message_auto_delete_time
properties.description: Optional. The time after which all messages sent to the chat will be automatically deleted; in seconds. Returned only in [getChat](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#getchat).

properties.name: permissions
properties.description: Optional. Default chat member permissions, for groups and supergroups. Returned only in [getChat](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#getchat).

properties.name: photo
properties.description: Optional. Chat photo. Returned only in [getChat](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#getchat).

properties.name: pinned_message
properties.description: Optional. The most recent pinned message (by sending date). Returned only in [getChat](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#getchat).

properties.name: slow_mode_delay
properties.description: Optional. For supergroups, the minimum allowed delay between consecutive messages sent by each unpriviledged user; in seconds. Returned only in [getChat](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#getchat).

properties.name: sticker_set_name
properties.description: Optional. For supergroups, name of group sticker set. Returned only in [getChat](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#getchat).

properties.name: title
properties.description: Optional. Title, for supergroups, channels and group chats

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of chat, can be either “private”, “group”, “supergroup” or “channel”

properties.name: username
properties.description: Optional. Username, for private chats, supergroups and channels if available

ChatAdministratorRights.name: ChatAdministratorRights
ChatAdministratorRights.description: Represents the rights of an administrator in a chat.

properties.name: can_change_info
properties.description: True, if the user is allowed to change the chat title, photo and other settings

properties.name: can_delete_messages
properties.description: True, if the administrator can delete messages of other users

properties.name: can_edit_messages
properties.description: Optional. True, if the administrator can edit messages of other users and can pin messages; channels only

properties.name: can_invite_users
properties.description: True, if the user is allowed to invite new users to the chat

properties.name: can_manage_chat
properties.description: True, if the administrator can access the chat event log, chat statistics, message statistics in channels, see channel members, see anonymous administrators in supergroups and ignore slow mode. Implied by any other administrator privilege

properties.name: can_manage_topics
properties.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to create, rename, close, and reopen forum topics; supergroups only

properties.name: can_manage_video_chats
properties.description: True, if the administrator can manage video chats

properties.name: can_pin_messages
properties.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to pin messages; groups and supergroups only

properties.name: can_post_messages
properties.description: Optional. True, if the administrator can post in the channel; channels only

properties.name: can_promote_members
properties.description: True, if the administrator can add new administrators with a subset of their own privileges or demote administrators that they have promoted, directly or indirectly (promoted by administrators that were appointed by the user)

properties.name: can_restrict_members
properties.description: True, if the administrator can restrict, ban or unban chat members

properties.name: is_anonymous
properties.description: True, if the user's presence in the chat is hidden

ChatInviteLink.name: ChatInviteLink
ChatInviteLink.description: Represents an invite link for a chat.

properties.name: creates_join_request
properties.description: True, if users joining the chat via the link need to be approved by chat administrators

properties.name: creator
properties.description: Creator of the link

properties.name: expire_date
properties.description: Optional. Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the link will expire or has been expired

properties.name: invite_link
properties.description: The invite link. If the link was created by another chat administrator, then the second part of the link will be replaced with “…”.

properties.name: is_primary
properties.description: True, if the link is primary

properties.name: is_revoked
properties.description: True, if the link is revoked

properties.name: member_limit
properties.description: Optional. The maximum number of users that can be members of the chat simultaneously after joining the chat via this invite link; 1-99999

properties.name: name
properties.description: Optional. Invite link name

properties.name: pending_join_request_count
properties.description: Optional. Number of pending join requests created using this link

ChatJoinRequest.name: ChatJoinRequest
ChatJoinRequest.description: Represents a join request sent to a chat.

properties.name: bio
properties.description: Optional. Bio of the user.

properties.name: chat
properties.description: Chat to which the request was sent

properties.name: date
properties.description: Date the request was sent in Unix time

properties.name: from
properties.description: User that sent the join request

properties.name: invite_link
properties.description: Optional. Chat invite link that was used by the user to send the join request

properties.name: user_chat_id
properties.description: Identifier of a private chat with the user who sent the join request. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier. The bot can use this identifier for 24 hours to send messages until the join request is processed, assuming no other administrator contacted the user.

ChatLocation.name: ChatLocation
ChatLocation.description: Represents a location to which a chat is connected.

properties.name: address
properties.description: Location address; 1-64 characters, as defined by the chat owner

properties.name: location
properties.description: The location to which the supergroup is connected. Can't be a live location.

ChatMember.name: ChatMember
ChatMember.description:
This object contains information about one member of a chat. Currently, the following 6 types of chat members are supported:

- [ChatMemberOwner](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#chatmemberowner)
- [ChatMemberAdministrator](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#chatmemberadministrator)
- [ChatMemberMember](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#chatmembermember)
- [ChatMemberRestricted](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#chatmemberrestricted)
- [ChatMemberLeft](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#chatmemberleft)
- [ChatMemberBanned](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#chatmemberbanned)

ChatMemberAdministrator.name: ChatMemberAdministrator
ChatMemberAdministrator.description: Represents a [chat member](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#chatmember) that has some additional privileges.

properties.name: can_be_edited
properties.description: True, if the bot is allowed to edit administrator privileges of that user

properties.name: can_change_info
properties.description: True, if the user is allowed to change the chat title, photo and other settings

properties.name: can_delete_messages
properties.description: True, if the administrator can delete messages of other users

properties.name: can_edit_messages
properties.description: Optional. True, if the administrator can edit messages of other users and can pin messages; channels only

properties.name: can_invite_users
properties.description: True, if the user is allowed to invite new users to the chat

properties.name: can_manage_chat
properties.description: True, if the administrator can access the chat event log, chat statistics, message statistics in channels, see channel members, see anonymous administrators in supergroups and ignore slow mode. Implied by any other administrator privilege

properties.name: can_manage_topics
properties.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to create, rename, close, and reopen forum topics; supergroups only

properties.name: can_manage_video_chats
properties.description: True, if the administrator can manage video chats

properties.name: can_pin_messages
properties.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to pin messages; groups and supergroups only

properties.name: can_post_messages
properties.description: Optional. True, if the administrator can post in the channel; channels only

properties.name: can_promote_members
properties.description: True, if the administrator can add new administrators with a subset of their own privileges or demote administrators that they have promoted, directly or indirectly (promoted by administrators that were appointed by the user)

properties.name: can_restrict_members
properties.description: True, if the administrator can restrict, ban or unban chat members

properties.name: custom_title
properties.description: Optional. Custom title for this user

properties.name: is_anonymous
properties.description: True, if the user's presence in the chat is hidden

properties.name: status
properties.description: The member's status in the chat, always “administrator”

properties.name: user
properties.description: Information about the user

ChatMemberBanned.name: ChatMemberBanned
ChatMemberBanned.description: Represents a [chat member](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#chatmember) that was banned in the chat and can't return to the chat or view chat messages.

properties.name: status
properties.description: The member's status in the chat, always “kicked”

properties.name: until_date
properties.description: Date when restrictions will be lifted for this user; unix time. If 0, then the user is banned forever

properties.name: user
properties.description: Information about the user

ChatMemberLeft.name: ChatMemberLeft
ChatMemberLeft.description: Represents a [chat member](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#chatmember) that isn't currently a member of the chat, but may join it themselves.

properties.name: status
properties.description: The member's status in the chat, always “left”

properties.name: user
properties.description: Information about the user

ChatMemberMember.name: ChatMemberMember
ChatMemberMember.description: Represents a [chat member](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#chatmember) that has no additional privileges or restrictions.

properties.name: status
properties.description: The member's status in the chat, always “member”

properties.name: user
properties.description: Information about the user

ChatMemberOwner.name: ChatMemberOwner
ChatMemberOwner.description: Represents a [chat member](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#chatmember) that owns the chat and has all administrator privileges.

properties.name: custom_title
properties.description: Optional. Custom title for this user

properties.name: is_anonymous
properties.description: True, if the user's presence in the chat is hidden

properties.name: status
properties.description: The member's status in the chat, always “creator”

properties.name: user
properties.description: Information about the user

ChatMemberRestricted.name: ChatMemberRestricted
ChatMemberRestricted.description: Represents a [chat member](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#chatmember) that is under certain restrictions in the chat. Supergroups only.

properties.name: can_add_web_page_previews
properties.description: True, if the user is allowed to add web page previews to their messages

properties.name: can_change_info
properties.description: True, if the user is allowed to change the chat title, photo and other settings

properties.name: can_invite_users
properties.description: True, if the user is allowed to invite new users to the chat

properties.name: can_manage_topics
properties.description: True, if the user is allowed to create forum topics

properties.name: can_pin_messages
properties.description: True, if the user is allowed to pin messages

properties.name: can_send_audios
properties.description: True, if the user is allowed to send audios

properties.name: can_send_documents
properties.description: True, if the user is allowed to send documents

properties.name: can_send_messages
properties.description: True, if the user is allowed to send text messages, contacts, invoices, locations and venues

properties.name: can_send_other_messages
properties.description: True, if the user is allowed to send animations, games, stickers and use inline bots

properties.name: can_send_photos
properties.description: True, if the user is allowed to send photos

properties.name: can_send_polls
properties.description: True, if the user is allowed to send polls

properties.name: can_send_video_notes
properties.description: True, if the user is allowed to send video notes

properties.name: can_send_videos
properties.description: True, if the user is allowed to send videos

properties.name: can_send_voice_notes
properties.description: True, if the user is allowed to send voice notes

properties.name: is_member
properties.description: True, if the user is a member of the chat at the moment of the request

properties.name: status
properties.description: The member's status in the chat, always “restricted”

properties.name: until_date
properties.description: Date when restrictions will be lifted for this user; unix time. If 0, then the user is restricted forever

properties.name: user
properties.description: Information about the user

ChatMemberUpdated.name: ChatMemberUpdated
ChatMemberUpdated.description: This object represents changes in the status of a chat member.

properties.name: chat
properties.description: Chat the user belongs to

properties.name: date
properties.description: Date the change was done in Unix time

properties.name: from
properties.description: Performer of the action, which resulted in the change

properties.name: invite_link
properties.description: Optional. Chat invite link, which was used by the user to join the chat; for joining by invite link events only.

properties.name: new_chat_member
properties.description: New information about the chat member

properties.name: old_chat_member
properties.description: Previous information about the chat member

ChatPermissions.name: ChatPermissions
ChatPermissions.description: Describes actions that a non-administrator user is allowed to take in a chat.

properties.name: can_add_web_page_previews
properties.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to add web page previews to their messages

properties.name: can_change_info
properties.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to change the chat title, photo and other settings. Ignored in public supergroups

properties.name: can_invite_users
properties.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to invite new users to the chat

properties.name: can_manage_topics
properties.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to create forum topics. If omitted defaults to the value of can_pin_messages

properties.name: can_pin_messages
properties.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to pin messages. Ignored in public supergroups

properties.name: can_send_audios
properties.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to send audios

properties.name: can_send_documents
properties.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to send documents

properties.name: can_send_messages
properties.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to send text messages, contacts, invoices, locations and venues

properties.name: can_send_other_messages
properties.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to send animations, games, stickers and use inline bots

properties.name: can_send_photos
properties.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to send photos

properties.name: can_send_polls
properties.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to send polls

properties.name: can_send_video_notes
properties.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to send video notes

properties.name: can_send_videos
properties.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to send videos

properties.name: can_send_voice_notes
properties.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to send voice notes

ChatPhoto.name: ChatPhoto
ChatPhoto.description: This object represents a chat photo.

properties.name: big_file_id
properties.description: File identifier of big (640x640) chat photo. This file_id can be used only for photo download and only for as long as the photo is not changed.

properties.name: big_file_unique_id
properties.description: Unique file identifier of big (640x640) chat photo, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

properties.name: small_file_id
properties.description: File identifier of small (160x160) chat photo. This file_id can be used only for photo download and only for as long as the photo is not changed.

properties.name: small_file_unique_id
properties.description: Unique file identifier of small (160x160) chat photo, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

ChatShared.name: ChatShared
ChatShared.description: This object contains information about the chat whose identifier was shared with the bot using a [KeyboardButtonRequestChat](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#keyboardbuttonrequestchat) button.

properties.name: chat_id
properties.description: Identifier of the shared chat. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier. The bot may not have access to the chat and could be unable to use this identifier, unless the chat is already known to the bot by some other means.

properties.name: request_id
properties.description: Identifier of the request

ChosenInlineResult.name: ChosenInlineResult
ChosenInlineResult.description:
Represents a [result](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#inlinequeryresult) of an inline query that was chosen by the user and sent to their chat partner.
Note: It is necessary to enable [inline feedback](https://core.telegram.org/web/20230309033341/https://core.telegram.org/bots/inline#collecting-feedback) via [@BotFather](https://web.archive.org/web/20230309033341/https://t.me/botfather) in order to receive these objects in updates.

properties.name: from
properties.description: The user that chose the result

properties.name: inline_message_id
properties.description: Optional. Identifier of the sent inline message. Available only if there is an [inline keyboard](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#inlinekeyboardmarkup) attached to the message. Will be also received in [callback queries](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#callbackquery) and can be used to [edit](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#updating-messages) the message.

properties.name: location
properties.description: Optional. Sender location, only for bots that require user location

properties.name: query
properties.description: The query that was used to obtain the result

properties.name: result_id
properties.description: The unique identifier for the result that was chosen

Contact.name: Contact
Contact.description: This object represents a phone contact.

properties.name: first_name
properties.description: Contact's first name

properties.name: last_name
properties.description: Optional. Contact's last name

properties.name: phone_number
properties.description: Contact's phone number

properties.name: user_id
properties.description: Optional. Contact's user identifier in Telegram. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.

properties.name: vcard
properties.description: Optional. Additional data about the contact in the form of a [vCard](https://web.archive.org/web/20230309033341/https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/VCard)

Dice.name: Dice
Dice.description: This object represents an animated emoji that displays a random value.

properties.name: emoji
properties.description: Emoji on which the dice throw animation is based

properties.name: value
properties.description: Value of the dice, 1-6 for “”, “” and “” base emoji, 1-5 for “” and “” base emoji, 1-64 for “” base emoji

Document.name: Document
Document.description: This object represents a general file (as opposed to [photos](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#photosize), [voice messages](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#voice) and [audio files](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#audio)).

properties.name: file_id
properties.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file

properties.name: file_name
properties.description: Optional. Original filename as defined by sender

properties.name: file_size
properties.description: Optional. File size in bytes. It can be bigger than 2^31 and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this value.

properties.name: file_unique_id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

properties.name: mime_type
properties.description: Optional. MIME type of the file as defined by sender

properties.name: thumb
properties.description: Optional. Document thumbnail as defined by sender

EncryptedCredentials.name: EncryptedCredentials
EncryptedCredentials.description: Describes data required for decrypting and authenticating [EncryptedPassportElement](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#encryptedpassportelement). See the [Telegram Passport Documentation](https://core.telegram.org/web/20230309033341/https://core.telegram.org/passport#receiving-information) for a complete description of the data decryption and authentication processes.

properties.name: data
properties.description: Base64-encoded encrypted JSON-serialized data with unique user's payload, data hashes and secrets required for [EncryptedPassportElement](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#encryptedpassportelement) decryption and authentication

properties.name: hash
properties.description: Base64-encoded data hash for data authentication

properties.name: secret
properties.description: Base64-encoded secret, encrypted with the bot's public RSA key, required for data decryption

EncryptedPassportElement.name: EncryptedPassportElement
EncryptedPassportElement.description: Describes documents or other Telegram Passport elements shared with the bot by the user.

properties.name: data
properties.description: Optional. Base64-encoded encrypted Telegram Passport element data provided by the user, available for “personal_details”, “passport”, “driver_license”, “identity_card”, “internal_passport” and “address” types. Can be decrypted and verified using the accompanying [EncryptedCredentials](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#encryptedcredentials).

properties.name: email
properties.description: Optional. User's verified email address, available only for “email” type

properties.name: files
properties.description: Optional. Array of encrypted files with documents provided by the user, available for “utility_bill”, “bank_statement”, “rental_agreement”, “passport_registration” and “temporary_registration” types. Files can be decrypted and verified using the accompanying [EncryptedCredentials](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#encryptedcredentials).

properties.name: front_side
properties.description: Optional. Encrypted file with the front side of the document, provided by the user. Available for “passport”, “driver_license”, “identity_card” and “internal_passport”. The file can be decrypted and verified using the accompanying [EncryptedCredentials](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#encryptedcredentials).

properties.name: hash
properties.description: Base64-encoded element hash for using in [PassportElementErrorUnspecified](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#passportelementerrorunspecified)

properties.name: phone_number
properties.description: Optional. User's verified phone number, available only for “phone_number” type

properties.name: reverse_side
properties.description: Optional. Encrypted file with the reverse side of the document, provided by the user. Available for “driver_license” and “identity_card”. The file can be decrypted and verified using the accompanying [EncryptedCredentials](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#encryptedcredentials).

properties.name: selfie
properties.description: Optional. Encrypted file with the selfie of the user holding a document, provided by the user; available for “passport”, “driver_license”, “identity_card” and “internal_passport”. The file can be decrypted and verified using the accompanying [EncryptedCredentials](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#encryptedcredentials).

properties.name: translation
properties.description: Optional. Array of encrypted files with translated versions of documents provided by the user. Available if requested for “passport”, “driver_license”, “identity_card”, “internal_passport”, “utility_bill”, “bank_statement”, “rental_agreement”, “passport_registration” and “temporary_registration” types. Files can be decrypted and verified using the accompanying [EncryptedCredentials](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#encryptedcredentials).

properties.name: type
properties.description: Element type. One of “personal_details”, “passport”, “driver_license”, “identity_card”, “internal_passport”, “address”, “utility_bill”, “bank_statement”, “rental_agreement”, “passport_registration”, “temporary_registration”, “phone_number”, “email”.

File.name: File
File.description: This object represents a file ready to be downloaded. The file can be downloaded via the link https://api.telegram.org/file/bot<token>/<file_path>. It is guaranteed that the link will be valid for at least 1 hour. When the link expires, a new one can be requested by calling [getFile](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#getfile).

properties.name: file_id
properties.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file

properties.name: file_path
properties.description: Optional. File path. Use https://api.telegram.org/file/bot<token>/<file_path> to get the file.

properties.name: file_size
properties.description: Optional. File size in bytes. It can be bigger than 2^31 and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this value.

properties.name: file_unique_id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

ForceReply.name: ForceReply
ForceReply.description: Upon receiving a message with this object, Telegram clients will display a reply interface to the user (act as if the user has selected the bot's message and tapped 'Reply'). This can be extremely useful if you want to create user-friendly step-by-step interfaces without having to sacrifice [privacy mode](https://core.telegram.org/web/20230309033341/https://core.telegram.org/bots/features#privacy-mode).

properties.name: force_reply
properties.description: Shows reply interface to the user, as if they manually selected the bot's message and tapped 'Reply'

properties.name: input_field_placeholder
properties.description: Optional. The placeholder to be shown in the input field when the reply is active; 1-64 characters

properties.name: selective
properties.description: Optional. Use this parameter if you want to force reply from specific users only. Targets: 1) users that are @mentioned in the text of the [Message](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#message) object; 2) if the bot's message is a reply (has reply_to_message_id), sender of the original message.

ForumTopic.name: ForumTopic
ForumTopic.description: This object represents a forum topic.

properties.name: icon_color
properties.description: Color of the topic icon in RGB format

properties.name: icon_custom_emoji_id
properties.description: Optional. Unique identifier of the custom emoji shown as the topic icon

properties.name: message_thread_id
properties.description: Unique identifier of the forum topic

properties.name: name
properties.description: Name of the topic

ForumTopicClosed.name: ForumTopicClosed
ForumTopicClosed.description: This object represents a service message about a forum topic closed in the chat. Currently holds no information.

ForumTopicCreated.name: ForumTopicCreated
ForumTopicCreated.description: This object represents a service message about a new forum topic created in the chat.

properties.name: icon_color
properties.description: Color of the topic icon in RGB format

properties.name: icon_custom_emoji_id
properties.description: Optional. Unique identifier of the custom emoji shown as the topic icon

properties.name: name
properties.description: Name of the topic

ForumTopicEdited.name: ForumTopicEdited
ForumTopicEdited.description: This object represents a service message about an edited forum topic.

properties.name: icon_custom_emoji_id
properties.description: Optional. New identifier of the custom emoji shown as the topic icon, if it was edited; an empty string if the icon was removed

properties.name: name
properties.description: Optional. New name of the topic, if it was edited

ForumTopicReopened.name: ForumTopicReopened
ForumTopicReopened.description: This object represents a service message about a forum topic reopened in the chat. Currently holds no information.

Game.name: Game
Game.description: This object represents a game. Use BotFather to create and edit games, their short names will act as unique identifiers.

properties.name: animation
properties.description: Optional. Animation that will be displayed in the game message in chats. Upload via [BotFather](https://web.archive.org/web/20230309033341/https://t.me/botfather)

properties.name: description
properties.description: Description of the game

properties.name: photo
properties.description: Photo that will be displayed in the game message in chats.

properties.name: text
properties.description: Optional. Brief description of the game or high scores included in the game message. Can be automatically edited to include current high scores for the game when the bot calls [setGameScore](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#setgamescore), or manually edited using [editMessageText](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#editmessagetext). 0-4096 characters.

properties.name: text_entities
properties.description: Optional. Special entities that appear in text, such as usernames, URLs, bot commands, etc.

properties.name: title
properties.description: Title of the game

GameHighScore.name: GameHighScore
GameHighScore.description:
This object represents one row of the high scores table for a game.
And that's about all we've got for now.If you've got any questions, please check out our [Bot FAQ »](https://core.telegram.org/web/20230309033341/https://core.telegram.org/bots/faq)

properties.name: position
properties.description: Position in high score table for the game

properties.name: score
properties.description: Score

properties.name: user
properties.description: User

GeneralForumTopicHidden.name: GeneralForumTopicHidden
GeneralForumTopicHidden.description: This object represents a service message about General forum topic hidden in the chat. Currently holds no information.

GeneralForumTopicUnhidden.name: GeneralForumTopicUnhidden
GeneralForumTopicUnhidden.description: This object represents a service message about General forum topic unhidden in the chat. Currently holds no information.

InlineKeyboardButton.name: InlineKeyboardButton
InlineKeyboardButton.description: This object represents one button of an inline keyboard. You must use exactly one of the optional fields.

properties.name: callback_data
properties.description: Optional. Data to be sent in a [callback query](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#callbackquery) to the bot when button is pressed, 1-64 bytes

properties.name: callback_game
properties.description: Optional. Description of the game that will be launched when the user presses the button.NOTE: This type of button must always be the first button in the first row.

properties.name: login_url
properties.description: Optional. An HTTPS URL used to automatically authorize the user. Can be used as a replacement for the [Telegram Login Widget](https://core.telegram.org/web/20230309033341/https://core.telegram.org/widgets/login).

properties.name: pay
properties.description: Optional. Specify True, to send a [Pay button](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#payments).NOTE: This type of button must always be the first button in the first row and can only be used in invoice messages.

properties.name: switch_inline_query
properties.description: Optional. If set, pressing the button will prompt the user to select one of their chats, open that chat and insert the bot's username and the specified inline query in the input field. May be empty, in which case just the bot's username will be inserted.Note: This offers an easy way for users to start using your bot in [inline mode](https://core.telegram.org/web/20230309033341/https://core.telegram.org/bots/inline) when they are currently in a private chat with it. Especially useful when combined with [switch_pm…](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#answerinlinequery) actions - in this case the user will be automatically returned to the chat they switched from, skipping the chat selection screen.

properties.name: switch_inline_query_current_chat
properties.description: Optional. If set, pressing the button will insert the bot's username and the specified inline query in the current chat's input field. May be empty, in which case only the bot's username will be inserted.This offers a quick way for the user to open your bot in inline mode in the same chat - good for selecting something from multiple options.

properties.name: text
properties.description: Label text on the button

properties.name: url
properties.description: Optional. HTTP or tg:// URL to be opened when the button is pressed. Links tg://user?id=<user_id> can be used to mention a user by their ID without using a username, if this is allowed by their privacy settings.

properties.name: web_app
properties.description: Optional. Description of the [Web App](https://core.telegram.org/web/20230309033341/https://core.telegram.org/bots/webapps) that will be launched when the user presses the button. The Web App will be able to send an arbitrary message on behalf of the user using the method [answerWebAppQuery](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#answerwebappquery). Available only in private chats between a user and the bot.

InlineKeyboardMarkup.name: InlineKeyboardMarkup
InlineKeyboardMarkup.description:
This object represents an [inline keyboard](https://core.telegram.org/web/20230309033341/https://core.telegram.org/bots/features#inline-keyboards) that appears right next to the message it belongs to.
Note: This will only work in Telegram versions released after 9 April, 2016. Older clients will display unsupported message.

properties.name: inline_keyboard
properties.description: Array of button rows, each represented by an Array of [InlineKeyboardButton](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#inlinekeyboardbutton) objects

InlineQuery.name: InlineQuery
InlineQuery.description: This object represents an incoming inline query. When the user sends an empty query, your bot could return some default or trending results.

properties.name: chat_type
properties.description: Optional. Type of the chat from which the inline query was sent. Can be either “sender” for a private chat with the inline query sender, “private”, “group”, “supergroup”, or “channel”. The chat type should be always known for requests sent from official clients and most third-party clients, unless the request was sent from a secret chat

properties.name: from
properties.description: Sender

properties.name: id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this query

properties.name: location
properties.description: Optional. Sender location, only for bots that request user location

properties.name: offset
properties.description: Offset of the results to be returned, can be controlled by the bot

properties.name: query
properties.description: Text of the query (up to 256 characters)

InlineQueryResult.name: InlineQueryResult
InlineQueryResult.description:
This object represents one result of an inline query. Telegram clients currently support results of the following 20 types:

- [InlineQueryResultCachedAudio](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#inlinequeryresultcachedaudio)
- [InlineQueryResultCachedDocument](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#inlinequeryresultcacheddocument)
- [InlineQueryResultCachedGif](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#inlinequeryresultcachedgif)
- [InlineQueryResultCachedMpeg4Gif](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#inlinequeryresultcachedmpeg4gif)
- [InlineQueryResultCachedPhoto](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#inlinequeryresultcachedphoto)
- [InlineQueryResultCachedSticker](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#inlinequeryresultcachedsticker)
- [InlineQueryResultCachedVideo](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#inlinequeryresultcachedvideo)
- [InlineQueryResultCachedVoice](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#inlinequeryresultcachedvoice)
- [InlineQueryResultArticle](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#inlinequeryresultarticle)
- [InlineQueryResultAudio](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#inlinequeryresultaudio)
- [InlineQueryResultContact](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#inlinequeryresultcontact)
- [InlineQueryResultGame](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#inlinequeryresultgame)
- [InlineQueryResultDocument](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#inlinequeryresultdocument)
- [InlineQueryResultGif](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#inlinequeryresultgif)
- [InlineQueryResultLocation](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#inlinequeryresultlocation)
- [InlineQueryResultMpeg4Gif](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#inlinequeryresultmpeg4gif)
- [InlineQueryResultPhoto](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#inlinequeryresultphoto)
- [InlineQueryResultVenue](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#inlinequeryresultvenue)
- [InlineQueryResultVideo](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#inlinequeryresultvideo)
- [InlineQueryResultVoice](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#inlinequeryresultvoice)

Note: All URLs passed in inline query results will be available to end users and therefore must be assumed to be public.

InlineQueryResultArticle.name: InlineQueryResultArticle
InlineQueryResultArticle.description: Represents a link to an article or web page.

properties.name: description
properties.description: Optional. Short description of the result

properties.name: hide_url
properties.description: Optional. Pass True if you don't want the URL to be shown in the message

properties.name: id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 Bytes

properties.name: input_message_content
properties.description: Content of the message to be sent

properties.name: reply_markup
properties.description: Optional. [Inline keyboard](https://core.telegram.org/web/20230309033341/https://core.telegram.org/bots/features#inline-keyboards) attached to the message

properties.name: thumb_height
properties.description: Optional. Thumbnail height

properties.name: thumb_url
properties.description: Optional. Url of the thumbnail for the result

properties.name: thumb_width
properties.description: Optional. Thumbnail width

properties.name: title
properties.description: Title of the result

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the result, must be article

properties.name: url
properties.description: Optional. URL of the result

InlineQueryResultAudio.name: InlineQueryResultAudio
InlineQueryResultAudio.description:
Represents a link to an MP3 audio file. By default, this audio file will be sent by the user. Alternatively, you can use input_message_content to send a message with the specified content instead of the audio.
Note: This will only work in Telegram versions released after 9 April, 2016. Older clients will ignore them.

properties.name: audio_duration
properties.description: Optional. Audio duration in seconds

properties.name: audio_url
properties.description: A valid URL for the audio file

properties.name: caption
properties.description: Optional. Caption, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

properties.name: caption_entities
properties.description: Optional. List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

properties.name: id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 bytes

properties.name: input_message_content
properties.description: Optional. Content of the message to be sent instead of the audio

properties.name: parse_mode
properties.description: Optional. Mode for parsing entities in the audio caption. See [formatting options](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#formatting-options) for more details.

properties.name: performer
properties.description: Optional. Performer

properties.name: reply_markup
properties.description: Optional. [Inline keyboard](https://core.telegram.org/web/20230309033341/https://core.telegram.org/bots/features#inline-keyboards) attached to the message

properties.name: title
properties.description: Title

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the result, must be audio

InlineQueryResultCachedAudio.name: InlineQueryResultCachedAudio
InlineQueryResultCachedAudio.description:
Represents a link to an MP3 audio file stored on the Telegram servers. By default, this audio file will be sent by the user. Alternatively, you can use input_message_content to send a message with the specified content instead of the audio.
Note: This will only work in Telegram versions released after 9 April, 2016. Older clients will ignore them.

properties.name: audio_file_id
properties.description: A valid file identifier for the audio file

properties.name: caption
properties.description: Optional. Caption, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

properties.name: caption_entities
properties.description: Optional. List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

properties.name: id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 bytes

properties.name: input_message_content
properties.description: Optional. Content of the message to be sent instead of the audio

properties.name: parse_mode
properties.description: Optional. Mode for parsing entities in the audio caption. See [formatting options](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#formatting-options) for more details.

properties.name: reply_markup
properties.description: Optional. [Inline keyboard](https://core.telegram.org/web/20230309033341/https://core.telegram.org/bots/features#inline-keyboards) attached to the message

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the result, must be audio

InlineQueryResultCachedDocument.name: InlineQueryResultCachedDocument
InlineQueryResultCachedDocument.description:
Represents a link to a file stored on the Telegram servers. By default, this file will be sent by the user with an optional caption. Alternatively, you can use input_message_content to send a message with the specified content instead of the file.
Note: This will only work in Telegram versions released after 9 April, 2016. Older clients will ignore them.

properties.name: caption
properties.description: Optional. Caption of the document to be sent, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

properties.name: caption_entities
properties.description: Optional. List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

properties.name: description
properties.description: Optional. Short description of the result

properties.name: document_file_id
properties.description: A valid file identifier for the file

properties.name: id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 bytes

properties.name: input_message_content
properties.description: Optional. Content of the message to be sent instead of the file

properties.name: parse_mode
properties.description: Optional. Mode for parsing entities in the document caption. See [formatting options](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#formatting-options) for more details.

properties.name: reply_markup
properties.description: Optional. [Inline keyboard](https://core.telegram.org/web/20230309033341/https://core.telegram.org/bots/features#inline-keyboards) attached to the message

properties.name: title
properties.description: Title for the result

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the result, must be document

InlineQueryResultCachedGif.name: InlineQueryResultCachedGif
InlineQueryResultCachedGif.description: Represents a link to an animated GIF file stored on the Telegram servers. By default, this animated GIF file will be sent by the user with an optional caption. Alternatively, you can use input_message_content to send a message with specified content instead of the animation.

properties.name: caption
properties.description: Optional. Caption of the GIF file to be sent, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

properties.name: caption_entities
properties.description: Optional. List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

properties.name: gif_file_id
properties.description: A valid file identifier for the GIF file

properties.name: id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 bytes

properties.name: input_message_content
properties.description: Optional. Content of the message to be sent instead of the GIF animation

properties.name: parse_mode
properties.description: Optional. Mode for parsing entities in the caption. See [formatting options](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#formatting-options) for more details.

properties.name: reply_markup
properties.description: Optional. [Inline keyboard](https://core.telegram.org/web/20230309033341/https://core.telegram.org/bots/features#inline-keyboards) attached to the message

properties.name: title
properties.description: Optional. Title for the result

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the result, must be gif

InlineQueryResultCachedMpeg4Gif.name: InlineQueryResultCachedMpeg4Gif
InlineQueryResultCachedMpeg4Gif.description: Represents a link to a video animation (H.264/MPEG-4 AVC video without sound) stored on the Telegram servers. By default, this animated MPEG-4 file will be sent by the user with an optional caption. Alternatively, you can use input_message_content to send a message with the specified content instead of the animation.

properties.name: caption
properties.description: Optional. Caption of the MPEG-4 file to be sent, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

properties.name: caption_entities
properties.description: Optional. List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

properties.name: id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 bytes

properties.name: input_message_content
properties.description: Optional. Content of the message to be sent instead of the video animation

properties.name: mpeg4_file_id
properties.description: A valid file identifier for the MPEG4 file

properties.name: parse_mode
properties.description: Optional. Mode for parsing entities in the caption. See [formatting options](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#formatting-options) for more details.

properties.name: reply_markup
properties.description: Optional. [Inline keyboard](https://core.telegram.org/web/20230309033341/https://core.telegram.org/bots/features#inline-keyboards) attached to the message

properties.name: title
properties.description: Optional. Title for the result

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the result, must be mpeg4_gif

InlineQueryResultCachedPhoto.name: InlineQueryResultCachedPhoto
InlineQueryResultCachedPhoto.description: Represents a link to a photo stored on the Telegram servers. By default, this photo will be sent by the user with an optional caption. Alternatively, you can use input_message_content to send a message with the specified content instead of the photo.

properties.name: caption
properties.description: Optional. Caption of the photo to be sent, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

properties.name: caption_entities
properties.description: Optional. List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

properties.name: description
properties.description: Optional. Short description of the result

properties.name: id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 bytes

properties.name: input_message_content

InlineQueryResultCachedSticker.name: InlineQueryResultCachedSticker
InlineQueryResultCachedSticker.description:
Represents a link to a sticker stored on the Telegram servers. By default, this sticker will be sent by the user. Alternatively, you can use input_message_content to send a message with the specified content instead of the sticker.
Note: This will only work in Telegram versions released after 9 April, 2016 for static stickers and after 06 July, 2019 for [animated stickers](https://web.archive.org/web/20230309033341/https://telegram.org/blog/animated-stickers). Older clients will ignore them.

properties.name: id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 bytes

properties.name: input_message_content
properties.description: Optional. Content of the message to be sent instead of the sticker

properties.name: reply_markup
properties.description: Optional. [Inline keyboard](https://core.telegram.org/web/20230309033341/https://core.telegram.org/bots/features#inline-keyboards) attached to the message

properties.name: sticker_file_id
properties.description: A valid file identifier of the sticker

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the result, must be sticker

InlineQueryResultCachedVideo.name: InlineQueryResultCachedVideo
InlineQueryResultCachedVideo.description: Represents a link to a video file stored on the Telegram servers. By default, this video file will be sent by the user with an optional caption. Alternatively, you can use input_message_content to send a message with the specified content instead of the video.

properties.name: type

properties.name: video_file_id

InlineQueryResultCachedVoice.name: InlineQueryResultCachedVoice
InlineQueryResultCachedVoice.description:
Represents a link to a voice message stored on the Telegram servers. By default, this voice message will be sent by the user. Alternatively, you can use input_message_content to send a message with the specified content instead of the voice message.
Note: This will only work in Telegram versions released after 9 April, 2016. Older clients will ignore them.

properties.name: caption
properties.description: Optional. Caption, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

properties.name: caption_entities

properties.name: id

properties.name: input_message_content

properties.name: parse_mode

properties.name: type

properties.name: voice_file_id

InlineQueryResultContact.name: InlineQueryResultContact
InlineQueryResultContact.description:
Represents a contact with a phone number. By default, this contact will be sent by the user. Alternatively, you can use input_message_content to send a message with the specified content instead of the contact.
Note: This will only work in Telegram versions released after 9 April, 2016. Older clients will ignore them.

properties.name: first_name
properties.description: Contact's first name

properties.name: id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 Bytes

properties.name: input_message_content
properties.description: Optional. Content of the message to be sent instead of the contact

properties.name: last_name
properties.description: Optional. Contact's last name

properties.name: phone_number
properties.description: Contact's phone number

properties.name: reply_markup
properties.description: Optional. [Inline keyboard](https://core.telegram.org/web/20230309033341/https://core.telegram.org/bots/features#inline-keyboards) attached to the message

properties.name: thumb_height
properties.description: Optional. Thumbnail height

properties.name: thumb_url
properties.description: Optional. Url of the thumbnail for the result

properties.name: thumb_width
properties.description: Optional. Thumbnail width

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the result, must be contact

properties.name: vcard
properties.description: Optional. Additional data about the contact in the form of a [vCard](https://web.archive.org/web/20230309033341/https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/VCard), 0-2048 bytes

InlineQueryResultDocument.name: InlineQueryResultDocument
InlineQueryResultDocument.description:
Represents a link to a file. By default, this file will be sent by the user with an optional caption. Alternatively, you can use input_message_content to send a message with the specified content instead of the file. Currently, only .PDF and .ZIP files can be sent using this method.
Note: This will only work in Telegram versions released after 9 April, 2016. Older clients will ignore them.

properties.name: caption
properties.description: Optional. Caption of the document to be sent, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

properties.name: caption_entities
properties.description: Optional. List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

properties.name: description
properties.description: Optional. Short description of the result

properties.name: document_url
properties.description: A valid URL for the file

properties.name: id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 bytes

properties.name: input_message_content
properties.description: Optional. Content of the message to be sent instead of the file

properties.name: mime_type
properties.description: MIME type of the content of the file, either “application/pdf” or “application/zip”

properties.name: parse_mode
properties.description: Optional. Mode for parsing entities in the document caption. See [formatting options](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#formatting-options) for more details.

properties.name: reply_markup
properties.description: Optional. Inline keyboard attached to the message

properties.name: thumb_height
properties.description: Optional. Thumbnail height

properties.name: thumb_url
properties.description: Optional. URL of the thumbnail (JPEG only) for the file

properties.name: thumb_width
properties.description: Optional. Thumbnail width

properties.name: title
properties.description: Title for the result

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the result, must be document

InlineQueryResultGame.name: InlineQueryResultGame
InlineQueryResultGame.description:
Represents a [Game](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#games).
Note: This will only work in Telegram versions released after October 1, 2016. Older clients will not display any inline results if a game result is among them.

properties.name: game_short_name
properties.description: Short name of the game

properties.name: id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 bytes

properties.name: reply_markup
properties.description: Optional. [Inline keyboard](https://core.telegram.org/web/20230309033341/https://core.telegram.org/bots/features#inline-keyboards) attached to the message

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the result, must be game

InlineQueryResultGif.name: InlineQueryResultGif
InlineQueryResultGif.description: Represents a link to an animated GIF file. By default, this animated GIF file will be sent by the user with optional caption. Alternatively, you can use input_message_content to send a message with the specified content instead of the animation.

properties.name: caption
properties.description: Optional. Caption of the GIF file to be sent, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

properties.name: caption_entities
properties.description: Optional. List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

properties.name: gif_duration
properties.description: Optional. Duration of the GIF in seconds

properties.name: gif_height
properties.description: Optional. Height of the GIF

properties.name: gif_url
properties.description: A valid URL for the GIF file. File size must not exceed 1MB

properties.name: gif_width
properties.description: Optional. Width of the GIF

properties.name: id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 bytes

properties.name: input_message_content
properties.description: Optional. Content of the message to be sent instead of the GIF animation

properties.name: parse_mode
properties.description: Optional. Mode for parsing entities in the caption. See [formatting options](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#formatting-options) for more details.

properties.name: reply_markup
properties.description: Optional. [Inline keyboard](https://core.telegram.org/web/20230309033341/https://core.telegram.org/bots/features#inline-keyboards) attached to the message

properties.name: thumb_mime_type
properties.description: Optional. MIME type of the thumbnail, must be one of “image/jpeg”, “image/gif”, or “video/mp4”. Defaults to “image/jpeg”

properties.name: thumb_url
properties.description: URL of the static (JPEG or GIF) or animated (MPEG4) thumbnail for the result

properties.name: title
properties.description: Optional. Title for the result

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the result, must be gif

InlineQueryResultLocation.name: InlineQueryResultLocation
InlineQueryResultLocation.description:
Represents a location on a map. By default, the location will be sent by the user. Alternatively, you can use input_message_content to send a message with the specified content instead of the location.
Note: This will only work in Telegram versions released after 9 April, 2016. Older clients will ignore them.

properties.name: heading
properties.description: Optional. For live locations, a direction in which the user is moving, in degrees. Must be between 1 and 360 if specified.

properties.name: horizontal_accuracy
properties.description: Optional. The radius of uncertainty for the location, measured in meters; 0-1500

properties.name: id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 Bytes

properties.name: input_message_content
properties.description: Optional. Content of the message to be sent instead of the location

properties.name: latitude
properties.description: Location latitude in degrees

properties.name: live_period
properties.description: Optional. Period in seconds for which the location can be updated, should be between 60 and 86400.

properties.name: longitude
properties.description: Location longitude in degrees

properties.name: proximity_alert_radius
properties.description: Optional. For live locations, a maximum distance for proximity alerts about approaching another chat member, in meters. Must be between 1 and 100000 if specified.

properties.name: reply_markup
properties.description: Optional. [Inline keyboard](https://core.telegram.org/web/20230309033341/https://core.telegram.org/bots/features#inline-keyboards) attached to the message

properties.name: thumb_height
properties.description: Optional. Thumbnail height

properties.name: thumb_url
properties.description: Optional. Url of the thumbnail for the result

properties.name: thumb_width
properties.description: Optional. Thumbnail width

properties.name: title
properties.description: Location title

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the result, must be location

InlineQueryResultMpeg4Gif.name: InlineQueryResultMpeg4Gif
InlineQueryResultMpeg4Gif.description: Represents a link to a video animation (H.264/MPEG-4 AVC video without sound). By default, this animated MPEG-4 file will be sent by the user with optional caption. Alternatively, you can use input_message_content to send a message with the specified content instead of the animation.

properties.name: caption
properties.description: Optional. Caption of the MPEG-4 file to be sent, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

properties.name: caption_entities
properties.description: Optional. List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

properties.name: id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 bytes

properties.name: input_message_content
properties.description: Optional. Content of the message to be sent instead of the video animation

properties.name: mpeg4_duration
properties.description: Optional. Video duration in seconds

properties.name: mpeg4_height
properties.description: Optional. Video height

properties.name: mpeg4_url
properties.description: A valid URL for the MPEG4 file. File size must not exceed 1MB

properties.name: mpeg4_width
properties.description: Optional. Video width

properties.name: parse_mode
properties.description: Optional. Mode for parsing entities in the caption. See [formatting options](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#formatting-options) for more details.

properties.name: reply_markup
properties.description: Optional. [Inline keyboard](https://core.telegram.org/web/20230309033341/https://core.telegram.org/bots/features#inline-keyboards) attached to the message

properties.name: thumb_mime_type
properties.description: Optional. MIME type of the thumbnail, must be one of “image/jpeg”, “image/gif”, or “video/mp4”. Defaults to “image/jpeg”

properties.name: thumb_url
properties.description: URL of the static (JPEG or GIF) or animated (MPEG4) thumbnail for the result

properties.name: title
properties.description: Optional. Title for the result

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the result, must be mpeg4_gif

InlineQueryResultPhoto.name: InlineQueryResultPhoto
InlineQueryResultPhoto.description: Represents a link to a photo. By default, this photo will be sent by the user with optional caption. Alternatively, you can use input_message_content to send a message with the specified content instead of the photo.

properties.name: caption
properties.description: Optional. Caption of the photo to be sent, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

properties.name: caption_entities
properties.description: Optional. List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

properties.name: description
properties.description: Optional. Short description of the result

properties.name: id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 bytes

properties.name: input_message_content
properties.description: Optional. Content of the message to be sent instead of the photo

properties.name: parse_mode
properties.description: Optional. Mode for parsing entities in the photo caption. See [formatting options](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#formatting-options) for more details.

properties.name: photo_height
properties.description: Optional. Height of the photo

properties.name: photo_url
properties.description: A valid URL of the photo. Photo must be in JPEG format. Photo size must not exceed 5MB

properties.name: photo_width
properties.description: Optional. Width of the photo

properties.name: reply_markup
properties.description: Optional. [Inline keyboard](https://core.telegram.org/web/20230309033341/https://core.telegram.org/bots/features#inline-keyboards) attached to the message

properties.name: thumb_url
properties.description: URL of the thumbnail for the photo

properties.name: title
properties.description: Optional. Title for the result

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the result, must be photo

InlineQueryResultVenue.name: InlineQueryResultVenue
InlineQueryResultVenue.description:
Represents a venue. By default, the venue will be sent by the user. Alternatively, you can use input_message_content to send a message with the specified content instead of the venue.
Note: This will only work in Telegram versions released after 9 April, 2016. Older clients will ignore them.

properties.name: address
properties.description: Address of the venue

properties.name: foursquare_id
properties.description: Optional. Foursquare identifier of the venue if known

properties.name: foursquare_type
properties.description: Optional. Foursquare type of the venue, if known. (For example, “arts_entertainment/default”, “arts_entertainment/aquarium” or “food/icecream”.)

properties.name: google_place_id
properties.description: Optional. Google Places identifier of the venue

properties.name: google_place_type
properties.description: Optional. Google Places type of the venue. (See [supported types](https://web.archive.org/web/20230309033341/https://developers.google.com/places/web-service/supported_types).)

properties.name: id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 Bytes

properties.name: input_message_content
properties.description: Optional. Content of the message to be sent instead of the venue

properties.name: latitude
properties.description: Latitude of the venue location in degrees

properties.name: longitude
