properties.description: Longitude of the venue location in degrees

properties.name: reply_markup
properties.description: Optional. [Inline keyboard](https://core.telegram.org/web/20230309033341/https://core.telegram.org/bots/features#inline-keyboards) attached to the message

properties.name: thumb_height
properties.description: Optional. Thumbnail height

properties.name: thumb_url
properties.description: Optional. Url of the thumbnail for the result

properties.name: thumb_width
properties.description: Optional. Thumbnail width

properties.name: title
properties.description: Title of the venue

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the result, must be venue

InlineQueryResultVideo.name: InlineQueryResultVideo
InlineQueryResultVideo.description: Represents a link to a page containing an embedded video player or a video file. By default, this video file will be sent by the user with an optional caption. Alternatively, you can use input_message_content to send a message with the specified content instead of the video.

properties.name: caption
properties.description: Optional. Caption of the video to be sent, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

properties.name: caption_entities
properties.description: Optional. List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

properties.name: description
properties.description: Optional. Short description of the result

properties.name: id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 bytes

properties.name: input_message_content
properties.description: Optional. Content of the message to be sent instead of the video. This field is required if InlineQueryResultVideo is used to send an HTML-page as a result (e.g., a YouTube video).

properties.name: mime_type
properties.description: MIME type of the content of the video URL, “text/html” or “video/mp4”

properties.name: parse_mode
properties.description: Optional. Mode for parsing entities in the video caption. See [formatting options](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#formatting-options) for more details.

properties.name: reply_markup
properties.description: Optional. [Inline keyboard](https://core.telegram.org/web/20230309033341/https://core.telegram.org/bots/features#inline-keyboards) attached to the message

properties.name: thumb_url
properties.description: URL of the thumbnail (JPEG only) for the video

properties.name: title
properties.description: Title for the result

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the result, must be video

properties.name: video_duration
properties.description: Optional. Video duration in seconds

properties.name: video_height
properties.description: Optional. Video height

properties.name: video_url
properties.description: A valid URL for the embedded video player or video file

properties.name: video_width
properties.description: Optional. Video width

InlineQueryResultVoice.name: InlineQueryResultVoice
InlineQueryResultVoice.description:
Represents a link to a voice recording in an .OGG container encoded with OPUS. By default, this voice recording will be sent by the user. Alternatively, you can use input_message_content to send a message with the specified content instead of the the voice message.
Note: This will only work in Telegram versions released after 9 April, 2016. Older clients will ignore them.

properties.name: caption
properties.description: Optional. Caption, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

properties.name: caption_entities
properties.description: Optional. List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

properties.name: id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 bytes

properties.name: input_message_content
properties.description: Optional. Content of the message to be sent instead of the voice recording

properties.name: parse_mode
properties.description: Optional. Mode for parsing entities in the voice message caption. See [formatting options](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#formatting-options) for more details.

properties.name: reply_markup
properties.description: Optional. [Inline keyboard](https://core.telegram.org/web/20230309033341/https://core.telegram.org/bots/features#inline-keyboards) attached to the message

properties.name: title
properties.description: Recording title

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the result, must be voice

properties.name: voice_duration
properties.description: Optional. Recording duration in seconds

properties.name: voice_url
properties.description: A valid URL for the voice recording

InputContactMessageContent.name: InputContactMessageContent
InputContactMessageContent.description: Represents the [content](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#inputmessagecontent) of a contact message to be sent as the result of an inline query.

properties.name: first_name
properties.description: Contact's first name

properties.name: last_name
properties.description: Optional. Contact's last name

properties.name: phone_number
properties.description: Contact's phone number

properties.name: vcard
properties.description: Optional. Additional data about the contact in the form of a [vCard](https://web.archive.org/web/20230309033341/https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/VCard), 0-2048 bytes

InputFile.name: InputFile
InputFile.description: This object represents the contents of a file to be uploaded. Must be posted using multipart/form-data in the usual way that files are uploaded via the browser.

InputInvoiceMessageContent.name: InputInvoiceMessageContent
InputInvoiceMessageContent.description: Represents the [content](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#inputmessagecontent) of an invoice message to be sent as the result of an inline query.

properties.name: currency
properties.description: Three-letter ISO 4217 currency code, see [more on currencies](https://core.telegram.org/web/20230309033341/https://core.telegram.org/bots/payments#supported-currencies)

properties.name: description
properties.description: Product description, 1-255 characters

properties.name: is_flexible
properties.description: Optional. Pass True if the final price depends on the shipping method

properties.name: max_tip_amount
properties.description: Optional. The maximum accepted amount for tips in the smallest units of the currency (integer, not float/double). For example, for a maximum tip of US$ 1.45 pass max_tip_amount = 145. See the exp parameter in [currencies.json](https://core.telegram.org/web/20230309033341/https://core.telegram.org/bots/payments/currencies.json), it shows the number of digits past the decimal point for each currency (2 for the majority of currencies). Defaults to 0

properties.name: need_email
properties.description: Optional. Pass True if you require the user's email address to complete the order

properties.name: need_name
properties.description: Optional. Pass True if you require the user's full name to complete the order

properties.name: need_phone_number
properties.description: Optional. Pass True if you require the user's phone number to complete the order

properties.name: need_shipping_address
properties.description: Optional. Pass True if you require the user's shipping address to complete the order

properties.name: payload
properties.description: Bot-defined invoice payload, 1-128 bytes. This will not be displayed to the user, use for your internal processes.

properties.name: photo_height
properties.description: Optional. Photo height

properties.name: photo_size
properties.description: Optional. Photo size in bytes

properties.name: photo_url
properties.description: Optional. URL of the product photo for the invoice. Can be a photo of the goods or a marketing image for a service.

properties.name: photo_width
properties.description: Optional. Photo width

properties.name: prices
properties.description: Price breakdown, a JSON-serialized list of components (e.g. product price, tax, discount, delivery cost, delivery tax, bonus, etc.)

properties.name: provider_data
properties.description: Optional. A JSON-serialized object for data about the invoice, which will be shared with the payment provider. A detailed description of the required fields should be provided by the payment provider.

properties.name: provider_token
properties.description: Payment provider token, obtained via [@BotFather](https://web.archive.org/web/20230309033341/https://t.me/botfather)

properties.name: send_email_to_provider
properties.description: Optional. Pass True if the user's email address should be sent to provider

properties.name: send_phone_number_to_provider
properties.description: Optional. Pass True if the user's phone number should be sent to provider

properties.name: suggested_tip_amounts
properties.description: Optional. A JSON-serialized array of suggested amounts of tip in the smallest units of the currency (integer, not float/double). At most 4 suggested tip amounts can be specified. The suggested tip amounts must be positive, passed in a strictly increased order and must not exceed max_tip_amount.

properties.name: title
properties.description: Product name, 1-32 characters

InputLocationMessageContent.name: InputLocationMessageContent
InputLocationMessageContent.description: Represents the [content](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#inputmessagecontent) of a location message to be sent as the result of an inline query.

properties.name: heading
properties.description: Optional. For live locations, a direction in which the user is moving, in degrees. Must be between 1 and 360 if specified.

properties.name: horizontal_accuracy
properties.description: Optional. The radius of uncertainty for the location, measured in meters; 0-1500

properties.name: latitude
properties.description: Latitude of the location in degrees

properties.name: live_period
properties.description: Optional. Period in seconds for which the location can be updated, should be between 60 and 86400.

properties.name: longitude
properties.description: Longitude of the location in degrees

properties.name: proximity_alert_radius
properties.description: Optional. For live locations, a maximum distance for proximity alerts about approaching another chat member, in meters. Must be between 1 and 100000 if specified.

InputMedia.name: InputMedia
InputMedia.description:
This object represents the content of a media message to be sent. It should be one of

- [InputMediaAnimation](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#inputmediaanimation)
- [InputMediaDocument](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#inputmediadocument)
- [InputMediaAudio](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#inputmediaaudio)
- [InputMediaPhoto](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#inputmediaphoto)
- [InputMediaVideo](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#inputmediavideo)

InputMediaAnimation.name: InputMediaAnimation
InputMediaAnimation.description: Represents an animation file (GIF or H.264/MPEG-4 AVC video without sound) to be sent.

properties.name: caption
properties.description: Optional. Caption of the animation to be sent, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

properties.name: caption_entities
properties.description: Optional. List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

properties.name: duration
properties.description: Optional. Animation duration in seconds

properties.name: has_spoiler
properties.description: Optional. Pass True if the animation needs to be covered with a spoiler animation

properties.name: height
properties.description: Optional. Animation height

properties.name: media
properties.description: File to send. Pass a file_id to send a file that exists on the Telegram servers (recommended), pass an HTTP URL for Telegram to get a file from the Internet, or pass “attach://<file_attach_name>” to upload a new one using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name> name. [More information on Sending Files »](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#sending-files)

properties.name: parse_mode
properties.description: Optional. Mode for parsing entities in the animation caption. See [formatting options](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#formatting-options) for more details.

properties.name: thumb
properties.description: Optional. Thumbnail of the file sent; can be ignored if thumbnail generation for the file is supported server-side. The thumbnail should be in JPEG format and less than 200 kB in size. A thumbnail's width and height should not exceed 320. Ignored if the file is not uploaded using multipart/form-data. Thumbnails can't be reused and can be only uploaded as a new file, so you can pass “attach://<file_attach_name>” if the thumbnail was uploaded using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name>. [More information on Sending Files »](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#sending-files)

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the result, must be animation

properties.name: width
properties.description: Optional. Animation width

InputMediaAudio.name: InputMediaAudio
InputMediaAudio.description: Represents an audio file to be treated as music to be sent.

properties.name: caption
properties.description: Optional. Caption of the audio to be sent, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

properties.name: caption_entities
properties.description: Optional. List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

properties.name: duration
properties.description: Optional. Duration of the audio in seconds

properties.name: media
properties.description: File to send. Pass a file_id to send a file that exists on the Telegram servers (recommended), pass an HTTP URL for Telegram to get a file from the Internet, or pass “attach://<file_attach_name>” to upload a new one using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name> name. [More information on Sending Files »](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#sending-files)

properties.name: parse_mode
properties.description: Optional. Mode for parsing entities in the audio caption. See [formatting options](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#formatting-options) for more details.

properties.name: performer
properties.description: Optional. Performer of the audio

properties.name: thumb
properties.description: Optional. Thumbnail of the file sent; can be ignored if thumbnail generation for the file is supported server-side. The thumbnail should be in JPEG format and less than 200 kB in size. A thumbnail's width and height should not exceed 320. Ignored if the file is not uploaded using multipart/form-data. Thumbnails can't be reused and can be only uploaded as a new file, so you can pass “attach://<file_attach_name>” if the thumbnail was uploaded using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name>. [More information on Sending Files »](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#sending-files)

properties.name: title
properties.description: Optional. Title of the audio

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the result, must be audio

InputMediaDocument.name: InputMediaDocument
InputMediaDocument.description: Represents a general file to be sent.

properties.name: caption
properties.description: Optional. Caption of the document to be sent, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

properties.name: caption_entities
properties.description: Optional. List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

properties.name: disable_content_type_detection
properties.description: Optional. Disables automatic server-side content type detection for files uploaded using multipart/form-data. Always True, if the document is sent as part of an album.

properties.name: media
properties.description: File to send. Pass a file_id to send a file that exists on the Telegram servers (recommended), pass an HTTP URL for Telegram to get a file from the Internet, or pass “attach://<file_attach_name>” to upload a new one using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name> name. [More information on Sending Files »](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#sending-files)

properties.name: parse_mode
properties.description: Optional. Mode for parsing entities in the document caption. See [formatting options](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#formatting-options) for more details.

properties.name: thumb
properties.description: Optional. Thumbnail of the file sent; can be ignored if thumbnail generation for the file is supported server-side. The thumbnail should be in JPEG format and less than 200 kB in size. A thumbnail's width and height should not exceed 320. Ignored if the file is not uploaded using multipart/form-data. Thumbnails can't be reused and can be only uploaded as a new file, so you can pass “attach://<file_attach_name>” if the thumbnail was uploaded using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name>. [More information on Sending Files »](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#sending-files)

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the result, must be document

InputMediaPhoto.name: InputMediaPhoto
InputMediaPhoto.description: Represents a photo to be sent.

properties.name: caption
properties.description: Optional. Caption of the photo to be sent, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

properties.name: caption_entities
properties.description: Optional. List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

properties.name: has_spoiler
properties.description: Optional. Pass True if the photo needs to be covered with a spoiler animation

properties.name: media
properties.description: File to send. Pass a file_id to send a file that exists on the Telegram servers (recommended), pass an HTTP URL for Telegram to get a file from the Internet, or pass “attach://<file_attach_name>” to upload a new one using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name> name. [More information on Sending Files »](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#sending-files)

properties.name: parse_mode
properties.description: Optional. Mode for parsing entities in the photo caption. See [formatting options](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#formatting-options) for more details.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the result, must be photo

InputMediaVideo.name: InputMediaVideo
InputMediaVideo.description: Represents a video to be sent.

properties.name: caption
properties.description: Optional. Caption of the video to be sent, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

properties.name: caption_entities
properties.description: Optional. List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

properties.name: duration
properties.description: Optional. Video duration in seconds

properties.name: has_spoiler
properties.description: Optional. Pass True if the video needs to be covered with a spoiler animation

properties.name: height
properties.description: Optional. Video height

properties.name: media
properties.description: File to send. Pass a file_id to send a file that exists on the Telegram servers (recommended), pass an HTTP URL for Telegram to get a file from the Internet, or pass “attach://<file_attach_name>” to upload a new one using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name> name. [More information on Sending Files »](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#sending-files)

properties.name: parse_mode
properties.description: Optional. Mode for parsing entities in the video caption. See [formatting options](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#formatting-options) for more details.

properties.name: supports_streaming
properties.description: Optional. Pass True if the uploaded video is suitable for streaming

properties.name: thumb
properties.description: Optional. Thumbnail of the file sent; can be ignored if thumbnail generation for the file is supported server-side. The thumbnail should be in JPEG format and less than 200 kB in size. A thumbnail's width and height should not exceed 320. Ignored if the file is not uploaded using multipart/form-data. Thumbnails can't be reused and can be only uploaded as a new file, so you can pass “attach://<file_attach_name>” if the thumbnail was uploaded using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name>. [More information on Sending Files »](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#sending-files)

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the result, must be video

properties.name: width
properties.description: Optional. Video width

InputMessageContent.name: InputMessageContent
InputMessageContent.description:
This object represents the content of a message to be sent as a result of an inline query. Telegram clients currently support the following 5 types:

- [InputTextMessageContent](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#inputtextmessagecontent)
- [InputLocationMessageContent](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#inputlocationmessagecontent)
- [InputVenueMessageContent](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#inputvenuemessagecontent)
- [InputContactMessageContent](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#inputcontactmessagecontent)
- [InputInvoiceMessageContent](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#inputinvoicemessagecontent)

InputTextMessageContent.name: InputTextMessageContent
InputTextMessageContent.description: Represents the [content](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#inputmessagecontent) of a text message to be sent as the result of an inline query.

properties.name: disable_web_page_preview
properties.description: Optional. Disables link previews for links in the sent message

properties.name: entities
properties.description: Optional. List of special entities that appear in message text, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

properties.name: message_text
properties.description: Text of the message to be sent, 1-4096 characters

properties.name: parse_mode
properties.description: Optional. Mode for parsing entities in the message text. See [formatting options](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#formatting-options) for more details.

InputVenueMessageContent.name: InputVenueMessageContent
InputVenueMessageContent.description: Represents the [content](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#inputmessagecontent) of a venue message to be sent as the result of an inline query.

properties.name: address
properties.description: Address of the venue

properties.name: foursquare_id
properties.description: Optional. Foursquare identifier of the venue, if known

properties.name: foursquare_type
properties.description: Optional. Foursquare type of the venue, if known. (For example, “arts_entertainment/default”, “arts_entertainment/aquarium” or “food/icecream”.)

properties.name: google_place_id
properties.description: Optional. Google Places identifier of the venue

properties.name: google_place_type
properties.description: Optional. Google Places type of the venue. (See [supported types](https://web.archive.org/web/20230309033341/https://developers.google.com/places/web-service/supported_types).)

properties.name: latitude
properties.description: Latitude of the venue in degrees

properties.name: longitude
properties.description: Longitude of the venue in degrees

properties.name: title
properties.description: Name of the venue

Invoice.name: Invoice
Invoice.description: This object contains basic information about an invoice.

properties.name: currency
properties.description: Three-letter ISO 4217 [currency](https://core.telegram.org/web/20230309033341/https://core.telegram.org/bots/payments#supported-currencies) code

properties.name: description
properties.description: Product description

properties.name: start_parameter
properties.description: Unique bot deep-linking parameter that can be used to generate this invoice

properties.name: title
properties.description: Product name

properties.name: total_amount
properties.description: Total price in the smallest units of the currency (integer, not float/double). For example, for a price of US$ 1.45 pass amount = 145. See the exp parameter in [currencies.json](https://core.telegram.org/web/20230309033341/https://core.telegram.org/bots/payments/currencies.json), it shows the number of digits past the decimal point for each currency (2 for the majority of currencies).

KeyboardButton.name: KeyboardButton
KeyboardButton.description:
This object represents one button of the reply keyboard. For simple text buttons, String can be used instead of this object to specify the button text. The optional fields web_app, request_user, request_chat, request_contact, request_location, and request_poll are mutually exclusive.
Note: request_contact and request_location options will only work in Telegram versions released after 9 April, 2016. Older clients will display unsupported message.Note: request_poll option will only work in Telegram versions released after 23 January, 2020. Older clients will display unsupported message.Note: web_app option will only work in Telegram versions released after 16 April, 2022. Older clients will display unsupported message.Note: request_user and request_chat options will only work in Telegram versions released after 3 February, 2023. Older clients will display unsupported message.

properties.name: request_chat
properties.description: Optional. If specified, pressing the button will open a list of suitable chats. Tapping on a chat will send its identifier to the bot in a “chat_shared” service message. Available in private chats only.

properties.name: request_contact
properties.description: Optional. If True, the user's phone number will be sent as a contact when the button is pressed. Available in private chats only.

properties.name: request_location
properties.description: Optional. If True, the user's current location will be sent when the button is pressed. Available in private chats only.

properties.name: request_poll
properties.description: Optional. If specified, the user will be asked to create a poll and send it to the bot when the button is pressed. Available in private chats only.

properties.name: request_user
properties.description: Optional. If specified, pressing the button will open a list of suitable users. Tapping on any user will send their identifier to the bot in a “user_shared” service message. Available in private chats only.

properties.name: text
properties.description: Text of the button. If none of the optional fields are used, it will be sent as a message when the button is pressed

properties.name: web_app
properties.description: Optional. If specified, the described [Web App](https://core.telegram.org/web/20230309033341/https://core.telegram.org/bots/webapps) will be launched when the button is pressed. The Web App will be able to send a “web_app_data” service message. Available in private chats only.

KeyboardButtonPollType.name: KeyboardButtonPollType
KeyboardButtonPollType.description: This object represents type of a poll, which is allowed to be created and sent when the corresponding button is pressed.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Optional. If quiz is passed, the user will be allowed to create only polls in the quiz mode. If regular is passed, only regular polls will be allowed. Otherwise, the user will be allowed to create a poll of any type.

KeyboardButtonRequestChat.name: KeyboardButtonRequestChat
KeyboardButtonRequestChat.description: This object defines the criteria used to request a suitable chat. The identifier of the selected chat will be shared with the bot when the corresponding button is pressed.

properties.name: bot_administrator_rights
properties.description: Optional. A JSON-serialized object listing the required administrator rights of the bot in the chat. The rights must be a subset of user_administrator_rights. If not specified, no additional restrictions are applied.

properties.name: bot_is_member
properties.description: Optional. Pass True to request a chat with the bot as a member. Otherwise, no additional restrictions are applied.

properties.name: chat_has_username
properties.description: Optional. Pass True to request a supergroup or a channel with a username, pass False to request a chat without a username. If not specified, no additional restrictions are applied.

properties.name: chat_is_channel
properties.description: Pass True to request a channel chat, pass False to request a group or a supergroup chat.

properties.name: chat_is_created
properties.description: Optional. Pass True to request a chat owned by the user. Otherwise, no additional restrictions are applied.

properties.name: chat_is_forum
properties.description: Optional. Pass True to request a forum supergroup, pass False to request a non-forum chat. If not specified, no additional restrictions are applied.

properties.name: request_id
properties.description: Signed 32-bit identifier of the request, which will be received back in the [ChatShared](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#chatshared) object. Must be unique within the message

properties.name: user_administrator_rights
properties.description: Optional. A JSON-serialized object listing the required administrator rights of the user in the chat. The rights must be a superset of bot_administrator_rights. If not specified, no additional restrictions are applied.

KeyboardButtonRequestUser.name: KeyboardButtonRequestUser
KeyboardButtonRequestUser.description: This object defines the criteria used to request a suitable user. The identifier of the selected user will be shared with the bot when the corresponding button is pressed.

properties.name: request_id
properties.description: Signed 32-bit identifier of the request, which will be received back in the [UserShared](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#usershared) object. Must be unique within the message

properties.name: user_is_bot
properties.description: Optional. Pass True to request a bot, pass False to request a regular user. If not specified, no additional restrictions are applied.

properties.name: user_is_premium
properties.description: Optional. Pass True to request a premium user, pass False to request a non-premium user. If not specified, no additional restrictions are applied.

LabeledPrice.name: LabeledPrice
LabeledPrice.description: This object represents a portion of the price for goods or services.

properties.name: amount
properties.description: Price of the product in the smallest units of the [currency](https://core.telegram.org/web/20230309033341/https://core.telegram.org/bots/payments#supported-currencies) (integer, not float/double). For example, for a price of US$ 1.45 pass amount = 145. See the exp parameter in [currencies.json](https://core.telegram.org/web/20230309033341/https://core.telegram.org/bots/payments/currencies.json), it shows the number of digits past the decimal point for each currency (2 for the majority of currencies).

properties.name: label
properties.description: Portion label

Location.name: Location
Location.description: This object represents a point on the map.

properties.name: heading
properties.description: Optional. The direction in which user is moving, in degrees; 1-360. For active live locations only.

properties.name: horizontal_accuracy
properties.description: Optional. The radius of uncertainty for the location, measured in meters; 0-1500

properties.name: latitude
properties.description: Latitude as defined by sender

properties.name: live_period
properties.description: Optional. Time relative to the message sending date, during which the location can be updated; in seconds. For active live locations only.

properties.name: longitude
properties.description: Longitude as defined by sender

properties.name: proximity_alert_radius
properties.description: Optional. The maximum distance for proximity alerts about approaching another chat member, in meters. For sent live locations only.

LoginUrl.name: LoginUrl
LoginUrl.description:
This object represents a parameter of the inline keyboard button used to automatically authorize a user. Serves as a great replacement for the [Telegram Login Widget](https://core.telegram.org/web/20230309033341/https://core.telegram.org/widgets/login) when the user is coming from Telegram. All the user needs to do is tap/click a button and confirm that they want to log in:
Telegram apps support these buttons as of [version 5.7](https://web.archive.org/web/20230309033341/https://telegram.org/blog/privacy-discussions-web-bots#meet-seamless-web-bots).

properties.name: bot_username
properties.description: Optional. Username of a bot, which will be used for user authorization. See [Setting up a bot](https://core.telegram.org/web/20230309033341/https://core.telegram.org/widgets/login#setting-up-a-bot) for more details. If not specified, the current bot's username will be assumed. The url's domain must be the same as the domain linked with the bot. See [Linking your domain to the bot](https://core.telegram.org/web/20230309033341/https://core.telegram.org/widgets/login#linking-your-domain-to-the-bot) for more details.

properties.name: forward_text
properties.description: Optional. New text of the button in forwarded messages.

properties.name: request_write_access
properties.description: Optional. Pass True to request the permission for your bot to send messages to the user.

properties.name: url
properties.description: An HTTPS URL to be opened with user authorization data added to the query string when the button is pressed. If the user refuses to provide authorization data, the original URL without information about the user will be opened. The data added is the same as described in [Receiving authorization data](https://core.telegram.org/web/20230309033341/https://core.telegram.org/widgets/login#receiving-authorization-data).NOTE: You must always check the hash of the received data to verify the authentication and the integrity of the data as described in [Checking authorization](https://core.telegram.org/web/20230309033341/https://core.telegram.org/widgets/login#checking-authorization).

MaskPosition.name: MaskPosition
MaskPosition.description: This object describes the position on faces where a mask should be placed by default.

properties.name: point
properties.description: The part of the face relative to which the mask should be placed. One of “forehead”, “eyes”, “mouth”, or “chin”.

properties.name: scale
properties.description: Mask scaling coefficient. For example, 2.0 means double size.

properties.name: x_shift
properties.description: Shift by X-axis measured in widths of the mask scaled to the face size, from left to right. For example, choosing -1.0 will place mask just to the left of the default mask position.

properties.name: y_shift
properties.description: Shift by Y-axis measured in heights of the mask scaled to the face size, from top to bottom. For example, 1.0 will place the mask just below the default mask position.

MenuButton.name: MenuButton
MenuButton.description:
This object describes the bot's menu button in a private chat. It should be one of

- [MenuButtonCommands](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#menubuttoncommands)
- [MenuButtonWebApp](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#menubuttonwebapp)
- [MenuButtonDefault](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#menubuttondefault)

If a menu button other than [MenuButtonDefault](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#menubuttondefault) is set for a private chat, then it is applied in the chat. Otherwise the default menu button is applied. By default, the menu button opens the list of bot commands.

MenuButtonCommands.name: MenuButtonCommands
MenuButtonCommands.description: Represents a menu button, which opens the bot's list of commands.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the button, must be commands

MenuButtonDefault.name: MenuButtonDefault
MenuButtonDefault.description: Describes that no specific value for the menu button was set.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the button, must be default

MenuButtonWebApp.name: MenuButtonWebApp
MenuButtonWebApp.description: Represents a menu button, which launches a [Web App](https://core.telegram.org/web/20230309033341/https://core.telegram.org/bots/webapps).

properties.name: text
properties.description: Text on the button

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the button, must be web_app

properties.name: web_app
properties.description: Description of the Web App that will be launched when the user presses the button. The Web App will be able to send an arbitrary message on behalf of the user using the method [answerWebAppQuery](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#answerwebappquery).

properties.name: animation
properties.description: Optional. Message is an animation, information about the animation. For backward compatibility, when this field is set, the document field will also be set

properties.name: audio
properties.description: Optional. Message is an audio file, information about the file

properties.name: author_signature
properties.description: Optional. Signature of the post author for messages in channels, or the custom title of an anonymous group administrator

properties.name: caption
properties.description: Optional. Caption for the animation, audio, document, photo, video or voice

properties.name: caption_entities
properties.description: Optional. For messages with a caption, special entities like usernames, URLs, bot commands, etc. that appear in the caption

properties.name: channel_chat_created
properties.description: Optional. Service message: the channel has been created. This field can't be received in a message coming through updates, because bot can't be a member of a channel when it is created. It can only be found in reply_to_message if someone replies to a very first message in a channel.

properties.name: chat
properties.description: Conversation the message belongs to

properties.name: chat_shared
properties.description: Optional. Service message: a chat was shared with the bot

properties.name: connected_website
properties.description: Optional. The domain name of the website on which the user has logged in. [More about Telegram Login »](https://core.telegram.org/web/20230309033341/https://core.telegram.org/widgets/login)

properties.name: contact
properties.description: Optional. Message is a shared contact, information about the contact

properties.name: date
properties.description: Date the message was sent in Unix time

properties.name: delete_chat_photo
properties.description: Optional. Service message: the chat photo was deleted

properties.name: dice
properties.description: Optional. Message is a dice with random value

properties.name: document
properties.description: Optional. Message is a general file, information about the file

properties.name: edit_date
properties.description: Optional. Date the message was last edited in Unix time

properties.name: entities
properties.description: Optional. For text messages, special entities like usernames, URLs, bot commands, etc. that appear in the text

properties.name: forum_topic_closed
properties.description: Optional. Service message: forum topic closed

properties.name: forum_topic_created
properties.description: Optional. Service message: forum topic created

properties.name: forum_topic_edited
properties.description: Optional. Service message: forum topic edited

properties.name: forum_topic_reopened
properties.description: Optional. Service message: forum topic reopened

properties.name: forward_date
properties.description: Optional. For forwarded messages, date the original message was sent in Unix time

properties.name: forward_from
properties.description: Optional. For forwarded messages, sender of the original message

properties.name: forward_from_chat
properties.description: Optional. For messages forwarded from channels or from anonymous administrators, information about the original sender chat

properties.name: forward_from_message_id
properties.description: Optional. For messages forwarded from channels, identifier of the original message in the channel

properties.name: forward_sender_name
properties.description: Optional. Sender's name for messages forwarded from users who disallow adding a link to their account in forwarded messages

properties.name: forward_signature
properties.description: Optional. For forwarded messages that were originally sent in channels or by an anonymous chat administrator, signature of the message sender if present

properties.name: from
properties.description: Optional. Sender of the message; empty for messages sent to channels. For backward compatibility, the field contains a fake sender user in non-channel chats, if the message was sent on behalf of a chat.

properties.name: game
properties.description: Optional. Message is a game, information about the game. [More about games »](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#games)

properties.name: general_forum_topic_hidden
properties.description: Optional. Service message: the 'General' forum topic hidden

properties.name: general_forum_topic_unhidden
properties.description: Optional. Service message: the 'General' forum topic unhidden

properties.name: group_chat_created
properties.description: Optional. Service message: the group has been created

properties.name: has_media_spoiler
properties.description: Optional. True, if the message media is covered by a spoiler animation

properties.name: has_protected_content
properties.description: Optional. True, if the message can't be forwarded

properties.name: invoice
properties.description: Optional. Message is an invoice for a [payment](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#payments), information about the invoice. [More about payments »](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#payments)

properties.name: is_automatic_forward
properties.description: Optional. True, if the message is a channel post that was automatically forwarded to the connected discussion group

properties.name: is_topic_message
properties.description: Optional. True, if the message is sent to a forum topic

properties.name: left_chat_member
properties.description: Optional. A member was removed from the group, information about them (this member may be the bot itself)

properties.name: location
properties.description: Optional. Message is a shared location, information about the location

properties.name: media_group_id
properties.description: Optional. The unique identifier of a media message group this message belongs to

properties.name: message_auto_delete_timer_changed
properties.description: Optional. Service message: auto-delete timer settings changed in the chat

properties.name: message_id
properties.description: Unique message identifier inside this chat

properties.name: message_thread_id
properties.description: Optional. Unique identifier of a message thread to which the message belongs; for supergroups only

properties.name: migrate_from_chat_id
properties.description: Optional. The supergroup has been migrated from a group with the specified identifier. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.

properties.name: migrate_to_chat_id
properties.description: Optional. The group has been migrated to a supergroup with the specified identifier. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.

properties.name: new_chat_members
properties.description: Optional. New members that were added to the group or supergroup and information about them (the bot itself may be one of these members)

properties.name: new_chat_photo
properties.description: Optional. A chat photo was change to this value

properties.name: new_chat_title
properties.description: Optional. A chat title was changed to this value

properties.name: passport_data
properties.description: Optional. Telegram Passport data

properties.name: photo
properties.description: Optional. Message is a photo, available sizes of the photo

properties.name: pinned_message
properties.description: Optional. Specified message was pinned. Note that the Message object in this field will not contain further reply_to_message fields even if it is itself a reply.

properties.name: poll
properties.description: Optional. Message is a native poll, information about the poll

properties.name: proximity_alert_triggered
properties.description: Optional. Service message. A user in the chat triggered another user's proximity alert while sharing Live Location.

properties.name: reply_markup
properties.description: Optional. Inline keyboard attached to the message. login_url buttons are represented as ordinary url buttons.

properties.name: reply_to_message
properties.description: Optional. For replies, the original message. Note that the Message object in this field will not contain further reply_to_message fields even if it itself is a reply.

properties.name: sender_chat
properties.description: Optional. Sender of the message, sent on behalf of a chat. For example, the channel itself for channel posts, the supergroup itself for messages from anonymous group administrators, the linked channel for messages automatically forwarded to the discussion group. For backward compatibility, the field from contains a fake sender user in non-channel chats, if the message was sent on behalf of a chat.

properties.name: sticker
properties.description: Optional. Message is a sticker, information about the sticker

properties.name: successful_payment
properties.description: Optional. Message is a service message about a successful payment, information about the payment. [More about payments »](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#payments)

properties.name: supergroup_chat_created
properties.description: Optional. Service message: the supergroup has been created. This field can't be received in a message coming through updates, because bot can't be a member of a supergroup when it is created. It can only be found in reply_to_message if someone replies to a very first message in a directly created supergroup.

properties.name: text
properties.description: Optional. For text messages, the actual UTF-8 text of the message

properties.name: user_shared
properties.description: Optional. Service message: a user was shared with the bot

properties.name: venue
properties.description: Optional. Message is a venue, information about the venue. For backward compatibility, when this field is set, the location field will also be set

properties.name: via_bot
properties.description: Optional. Bot through which the message was sent

properties.name: video
properties.description: Optional. Message is a video, information about the video

properties.name: video_chat_ended
properties.description: Optional. Service message: video chat ended

properties.name: video_chat_participants_invited
properties.description: Optional. Service message: new participants invited to a video chat

properties.name: video_chat_scheduled
properties.description: Optional. Service message: video chat scheduled

properties.name: video_chat_started
properties.description: Optional. Service message: video chat started

properties.name: video_note
properties.description: Optional. Message is a [video note](https://web.archive.org/web/20230309033341/https://telegram.org/blog/video-messages-and-telescope), information about the video message

properties.name: voice
properties.description: Optional. Message is a voice message, information about the file

properties.name: web_app_data
properties.description: Optional. Service message: data sent by a Web App

properties.name: write_access_allowed
properties.description: Optional. Service message: the user allowed the bot added to the attachment menu to write messages

MessageAutoDeleteTimerChanged.name: MessageAutoDeleteTimerChanged
MessageAutoDeleteTimerChanged.description: This object represents a service message about a change in auto-delete timer settings.

properties.name: message_auto_delete_time
properties.description: New auto-delete time for messages in the chat; in seconds

MessageEntity.name: MessageEntity
MessageEntity.description: This object represents one special entity in a text message. For example, hashtags, usernames, URLs, etc.

properties.name: custom_emoji_id
properties.description: Optional. For “custom_emoji” only, unique identifier of the custom emoji. Use [getCustomEmojiStickers](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#getcustomemojistickers) to get full information about the sticker

properties.name: language
properties.description: Optional. For “pre” only, the programming language of the entity text

properties.name: length
properties.description: Length of the entity in [UTF-16 code units](https://core.telegram.org/web/20230309033341/https://core.telegram.org/api/entities#entity-length)

properties.name: offset
properties.description: Offset in [UTF-16 code units](https://core.telegram.org/web/20230309033341/https://core.telegram.org/api/entities#entity-length) to the start of the entity

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the entity. Currently, can be “mention” (@username), “hashtag” (#hashtag), “cashtag” ($USD), “bot_command” (/start@jobs_bot), “url” (https://telegram.org), “email” (do-not-reply@telegram.org), “phone_number” (+1-212-555-0123), “bold” (bold text), “italic” (italic text), “underline” (underlined text), “strikethrough” (strikethrough text), “spoiler” (spoiler message), “code” (monowidth string), “pre” (monowidth block), “text_link” (for clickable text URLs), “text_mention” (for users [without usernames](https://web.archive.org/web/20230309033341/https://telegram.org/blog/edit#new-mentions)), “custom_emoji” (for inline custom emoji stickers)

properties.name: url
properties.description: Optional. For “text_link” only, URL that will be opened after user taps on the text

properties.name: user
properties.description: Optional. For “text_mention” only, the mentioned user

MessageId.name: MessageId
MessageId.description: This object represents a unique message identifier.

properties.name: message_id
properties.description: Unique message identifier

OrderInfo.name: OrderInfo
OrderInfo.description: This object represents information about an order.

properties.name: email
properties.description: Optional. User email

properties.name: name
properties.description: Optional. User name

properties.name: phone_number
properties.description: Optional. User's phone number

properties.name: shipping_address
properties.description: Optional. User shipping address

PassportData.name: PassportData
PassportData.description: Describes Telegram Passport data shared with the bot by the user.

properties.name: credentials
properties.description: Encrypted credentials required to decrypt the data

properties.name: data
properties.description: Array with information about documents and other Telegram Passport elements that was shared with the bot

PassportElementError.name: PassportElementError
PassportElementError.description:
This object represents an error in the Telegram Passport element which was submitted that should be resolved by the user. It should be one of:

- [PassportElementErrorDataField](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#passportelementerrordatafield)
- [PassportElementErrorFrontSide](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#passportelementerrorfrontside)
- [PassportElementErrorReverseSide](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#passportelementerrorreverseside)
- [PassportElementErrorSelfie](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#passportelementerrorselfie)
- [PassportElementErrorFile](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#passportelementerrorfile)
- [PassportElementErrorFiles](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#passportelementerrorfiles)
- [PassportElementErrorTranslationFile](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#passportelementerrortranslationfile)
- [PassportElementErrorTranslationFiles](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#passportelementerrortranslationfiles)
- [PassportElementErrorUnspecified](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#passportelementerrorunspecified)

PassportElementErrorDataField.name: PassportElementErrorDataField
PassportElementErrorDataField.description: Represents an issue in one of the data fields that was provided by the user. The error is considered resolved when the field's value changes.

properties.name: data_hash
properties.description: Base64-encoded data hash

properties.name: field_name
properties.description: Name of the data field which has the error

properties.name: message
properties.description: Error message

properties.name: source
properties.description: Error source, must be data

properties.name: type
properties.description: The section of the user's Telegram Passport which has the error, one of “personal_details”, “passport”, “driver_license”, “identity_card”, “internal_passport”, “address”

PassportElementErrorFile.name: PassportElementErrorFile
PassportElementErrorFile.description: Represents an issue with a document scan. The error is considered resolved when the file with the document scan changes.

properties.name: file_hash
properties.description: Base64-encoded file hash

properties.name: message
properties.description: Error message

properties.name: source
properties.description: Error source, must be file

properties.name: type
properties.description: The section of the user's Telegram Passport which has the issue, one of “utility_bill”, “bank_statement”, “rental_agreement”, “passport_registration”, “temporary_registration”

PassportElementErrorFiles.name: PassportElementErrorFiles
PassportElementErrorFiles.description: Represents an issue with a list of scans. The error is considered resolved when the list of files containing the scans changes.

properties.name: file_hashes
properties.description: List of base64-encoded file hashes

properties.name: message
properties.description: Error message

properties.name: source
properties.description: Error source, must be files

properties.name: type
properties.description: The section of the user's Telegram Passport which has the issue, one of “utility_bill”, “bank_statement”, “rental_agreement”, “passport_registration”, “temporary_registration”

PassportElementErrorFrontSide.name: PassportElementErrorFrontSide
PassportElementErrorFrontSide.description: Represents an issue with the front side of a document. The error is considered resolved when the file with the front side of the document changes.

properties.name: file_hash
properties.description: Base64-encoded hash of the file with the front side of the document

properties.name: message
properties.description: Error message

properties.name: source
properties.description: Error source, must be front_side

properties.name: type
properties.description: The section of the user's Telegram Passport which has the issue, one of “passport”, “driver_license”, “identity_card”, “internal_passport”

PassportElementErrorReverseSide.name: PassportElementErrorReverseSide
PassportElementErrorReverseSide.description: Represents an issue with the reverse side of a document. The error is considered resolved when the file with reverse side of the document changes.

properties.name: file_hash
properties.description: Base64-encoded hash of the file with the reverse side of the document

properties.name: message
properties.description: Error message

properties.name: source
properties.description: Error source, must be reverse_side

properties.name: type
properties.description: The section of the user's Telegram Passport which has the issue, one of “driver_license”, “identity_card”

PassportElementErrorSelfie.name: PassportElementErrorSelfie
PassportElementErrorSelfie.description: Represents an issue with the selfie with a document. The error is considered resolved when the file with the selfie changes.

properties.name: file_hash
properties.description: Base64-encoded hash of the file with the selfie

properties.name: message
properties.description: Error message

properties.name: source
properties.description: Error source, must be selfie

properties.name: type
properties.description: The section of the user's Telegram Passport which has the issue, one of “passport”, “driver_license”, “identity_card”, “internal_passport”

PassportElementErrorTranslationFile.name: PassportElementErrorTranslationFile
PassportElementErrorTranslationFile.description: Represents an issue with one of the files that constitute the translation of a document. The error is considered resolved when the file changes.

properties.name: file_hash
properties.description: Base64-encoded file hash

properties.name: message
properties.description: Error message

properties.name: source
properties.description: Error source, must be translation_file

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of element of the user's Telegram Passport which has the issue, one of “passport”, “driver_license”, “identity_card”, “internal_passport”, “utility_bill”, “bank_statement”, “rental_agreement”, “passport_registration”, “temporary_registration”

PassportElementErrorTranslationFiles.name: PassportElementErrorTranslationFiles
PassportElementErrorTranslationFiles.description: Represents an issue with the translated version of a document. The error is considered resolved when a file with the document translation change.

properties.name: file_hashes
properties.description: List of base64-encoded file hashes

properties.name: message
properties.description: Error message

properties.name: source
properties.description: Error source, must be translation_files

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of element of the user's Telegram Passport which has the issue, one of “passport”, “driver_license”, “identity_card”, “internal_passport”, “utility_bill”, “bank_statement”, “rental_agreement”, “passport_registration”, “temporary_registration”

PassportElementErrorUnspecified.name: PassportElementErrorUnspecified
PassportElementErrorUnspecified.description: Represents an issue in an unspecified place. The error is considered resolved when new data is added.

properties.name: element_hash
properties.description: Base64-encoded element hash

properties.name: message
properties.description: Error message

properties.name: source
properties.description: Error source, must be unspecified

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of element of the user's Telegram Passport which has the issue

PassportFile.name: PassportFile
PassportFile.description: This object represents a file uploaded to Telegram Passport. Currently all Telegram Passport files are in JPEG format when decrypted and don't exceed 10MB.

properties.name: file_date
properties.description: Unix time when the file was uploaded

properties.name: file_id
properties.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file

properties.name: file_size
properties.description: File size in bytes

properties.name: file_unique_id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

PhotoSize.name: PhotoSize
PhotoSize.description: This object represents one size of a photo or a [file](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#document) / [sticker](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#sticker) thumbnail.

properties.name: file_id
properties.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file

properties.name: file_size
properties.description: Optional. File size in bytes

properties.name: file_unique_id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

properties.name: height
properties.description: Photo height

properties.name: width
properties.description: Photo width

Poll.name: Poll
Poll.description: This object contains information about a poll.

properties.name: allows_multiple_answers
properties.description: True, if the poll allows multiple answers

properties.name: close_date
properties.description: Optional. Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the poll will be automatically closed

properties.name: correct_option_id
properties.description: Optional. 0-based identifier of the correct answer option. Available only for polls in the quiz mode, which are closed, or was sent (not forwarded) by the bot or to the private chat with the bot.

properties.name: explanation
properties.description: Optional. Text that is shown when a user chooses an incorrect answer or taps on the lamp icon in a quiz-style poll, 0-200 characters

properties.name: explanation_entities
properties.description: Optional. Special entities like usernames, URLs, bot commands, etc. that appear in the explanation

properties.name: id
properties.description: Unique poll identifier

properties.name: is_anonymous
properties.description: True, if the poll is anonymous

properties.name: is_closed
properties.description: True, if the poll is closed

properties.name: open_period
properties.description: Optional. Amount of time in seconds the poll will be active after creation

properties.name: options
properties.description: List of poll options

properties.name: question
properties.description: Poll question, 1-300 characters

properties.name: total_voter_count
properties.description: Total number of users that voted in the poll

properties.name: type
properties.description: Poll type, currently can be “regular” or “quiz”

PollAnswer.name: PollAnswer
PollAnswer.description: This object represents an answer of a user in a non-anonymous poll.

properties.name: option_ids
properties.description: 0-based identifiers of answer options, chosen by the user. May be empty if the user retracted their vote.

properties.name: poll_id
properties.description: Unique poll identifier

properties.name: user
properties.description: The user, who changed the answer to the poll

PollOption.name: PollOption
PollOption.description: This object contains information about one answer option in a poll.

properties.name: text
properties.description: Option text, 1-100 characters

properties.name: voter_count
properties.description: Number of users that voted for this option

PreCheckoutQuery.name: PreCheckoutQuery
PreCheckoutQuery.description: This object contains information about an incoming pre-checkout query.

properties.name: currency
properties.description: Three-letter ISO 4217 [currency](https://core.telegram.org/web/20230309033341/https://core.telegram.org/bots/payments#supported-currencies) code

properties.name: from
properties.description: User who sent the query

properties.name: id
properties.description: Unique query identifier

properties.name: invoice_payload
properties.description: Bot specified invoice payload

properties.name: order_info
properties.description: Optional. Order information provided by the user

properties.name: shipping_option_id
properties.description: Optional. Identifier of the shipping option chosen by the user

properties.name: total_amount
properties.description: Total price in the smallest units of the currency (integer, not float/double). For example, for a price of US$ 1.45 pass amount = 145. See the exp parameter in [currencies.json](https://core.telegram.org/web/20230309033341/https://core.telegram.org/bots/payments/currencies.json), it shows the number of digits past the decimal point for each currency (2 for the majority of currencies).

ProximityAlertTriggered.name: ProximityAlertTriggered
ProximityAlertTriggered.description: This object represents the content of a service message, sent whenever a user in the chat triggers a proximity alert set by another user.

properties.name: distance
properties.description: The distance between the users

properties.name: traveler
properties.description: User that triggered the alert

properties.name: watcher
properties.description: User that set the alert

ReplyKeyboardMarkup.name: ReplyKeyboardMarkup
ReplyKeyboardMarkup.description: This object represents a [custom keyboard](https://core.telegram.org/web/20230309033341/https://core.telegram.org/bots/features#keyboards) with reply options (see [Introduction to bots](https://core.telegram.org/web/20230309033341/https://core.telegram.org/bots/features#keyboards) for details and examples).

properties.name: input_field_placeholder
properties.description: Optional. The placeholder to be shown in the input field when the keyboard is active; 1-64 characters

properties.name: is_persistent
properties.description: Optional. Requests clients to always show the keyboard when the regular keyboard is hidden. Defaults to false, in which case the custom keyboard can be hidden and opened with a keyboard icon.

properties.name: keyboard
properties.description: Array of button rows, each represented by an Array of [KeyboardButton](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#keyboardbutton) objects

properties.name: one_time_keyboard
properties.description: Optional. Requests clients to hide the keyboard as soon as it's been used. The keyboard will still be available, but clients will automatically display the usual letter-keyboard in the chat - the user can press a special button in the input field to see the custom keyboard again. Defaults to false.

properties.name: resize_keyboard
properties.description: Optional. Requests clients to resize the keyboard vertically for optimal fit (e.g., make the keyboard smaller if there are just two rows of buttons). Defaults to false, in which case the custom keyboard is always of the same height as the app's standard keyboard.

properties.name: selective
properties.description: Optional. Use this parameter if you want to show the keyboard to specific users only. Targets: 1) users that are @mentioned in the text of the [Message](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#message) object; 2) if the bot's message is a reply (has reply_to_message_id), sender of the original message.Example: A user requests to change the bot's language, bot replies to the request with a keyboard to select the new language. Other users in the group don't see the keyboard.

ReplyKeyboardRemove.name: ReplyKeyboardRemove
ReplyKeyboardRemove.description: Upon receiving a message with this object, Telegram clients will remove the current custom keyboard and display the default letter-keyboard. By default, custom keyboards are displayed until a new keyboard is sent by a bot. An exception is made for one-time keyboards that are hidden immediately after the user presses a button (see [ReplyKeyboardMarkup](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#replykeyboardmarkup)).

properties.name: remove_keyboard
properties.description: Requests clients to remove the custom keyboard (user will not be able to summon this keyboard; if you want to hide the keyboard from sight but keep it accessible, use one_time_keyboard in [ReplyKeyboardMarkup](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#replykeyboardmarkup))

properties.name: selective
properties.description: Optional. Use this parameter if you want to remove the keyboard for specific users only. Targets: 1) users that are @mentioned in the text of the [Message](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#message) object; 2) if the bot's message is a reply (has reply_to_message_id), sender of the original message.Example: A user votes in a poll, bot returns confirmation message in reply to the vote and removes the keyboard for that user, while still showing the keyboard with poll options to users who haven't voted yet.

ResponseParameters.name: ResponseParameters
ResponseParameters.description: Describes why a request was unsuccessful.

properties.name: migrate_to_chat_id
properties.description: Optional. The group has been migrated to a supergroup with the specified identifier. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.

properties.name: retry_after
properties.description: Optional. In case of exceeding flood control, the number of seconds left to wait before the request can be repeated

SentWebAppMessage.name: SentWebAppMessage
SentWebAppMessage.description: Describes an inline message sent by a [Web App](https://core.telegram.org/web/20230309033341/https://core.telegram.org/bots/webapps) on behalf of a user.

properties.name: inline_message_id
properties.description: Optional. Identifier of the sent inline message. Available only if there is an [inline keyboard](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#inlinekeyboardmarkup) attached to the message.

ShippingAddress.name: ShippingAddress
ShippingAddress.description: This object represents a shipping address.

properties.name: city
properties.description: City

properties.name: country_code
properties.description: Two-letter ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code

properties.name: post_code
properties.description: Address post code

properties.name: state
properties.description: State, if applicable

properties.name: street_line1
properties.description: First line for the address

properties.name: street_line2
properties.description: Second line for the address

ShippingOption.name: ShippingOption
ShippingOption.description: This object represents one shipping option.

properties.name: id
properties.description: Shipping option identifier

properties.name: prices
properties.description: List of price portions

properties.name: title
properties.description: Option title

ShippingQuery.name: ShippingQuery
ShippingQuery.description: This object contains information about an incoming shipping query.

properties.name: from
properties.description: User who sent the query

properties.name: id
properties.description: Unique query identifier

properties.name: invoice_payload
properties.description: Bot specified invoice payload

properties.name: shipping_address
properties.description: User specified shipping address

properties.name: custom_emoji_id
properties.description: Optional. For custom emoji stickers, unique identifier of the custom emoji

properties.name: emoji
properties.description: Optional. Emoji associated with the sticker

properties.name: file_id
properties.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file

properties.name: file_size
properties.description: Optional. File size in bytes

properties.name: file_unique_id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

properties.name: height
properties.description: Sticker height

properties.name: is_animated
properties.description: True, if the sticker is [animated](https://web.archive.org/web/20230309033341/https://telegram.org/blog/animated-stickers)

properties.name: is_video
properties.description: True, if the sticker is a [video sticker](https://web.archive.org/web/20230309033341/https://telegram.org/blog/video-stickers-better-reactions)

properties.name: mask_position
properties.description: Optional. For mask stickers, the position where the mask should be placed

properties.name: premium_animation
properties.description: Optional. For premium regular stickers, premium animation for the sticker

properties.name: set_name
properties.description: Optional. Name of the sticker set to which the sticker belongs

properties.name: thumb
properties.description: Optional. Sticker thumbnail in the .WEBP or .JPG format

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the sticker, currently one of “regular”, “mask”, “custom_emoji”. The type of the sticker is independent from its format, which is determined by the fields is_animated and is_video.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Sticker width

StickerSet.name: StickerSet
StickerSet.description: This object represents a sticker set.

properties.name: is_animated
properties.description: True, if the sticker set contains [animated stickers](https://web.archive.org/web/20230309033341/https://telegram.org/blog/animated-stickers)

properties.name: is_video
properties.description: True, if the sticker set contains [video stickers](https://web.archive.org/web/20230309033341/https://telegram.org/blog/video-stickers-better-reactions)

properties.name: name
properties.description: Sticker set name

properties.name: sticker_type
properties.description: Type of stickers in the set, currently one of “regular”, “mask”, “custom_emoji”

properties.name: stickers
properties.description: List of all set stickers

properties.name: thumb
properties.description: Optional. Sticker set thumbnail in the .WEBP, .TGS, or .WEBM format

properties.name: title
properties.description: Sticker set title

SuccessfulPayment.name: SuccessfulPayment
SuccessfulPayment.description: This object contains basic information about a successful payment.

properties.name: currency
properties.description: Three-letter ISO 4217 [currency](https://core.telegram.org/web/20230309033341/https://core.telegram.org/bots/payments#supported-currencies) code

properties.name: invoice_payload
properties.description: Bot specified invoice payload

properties.name: order_info
properties.description: Optional. Order information provided by the user

properties.name: provider_payment_charge_id
properties.description: Provider payment identifier

properties.name: shipping_option_id
properties.description: Optional. Identifier of the shipping option chosen by the user

properties.name: telegram_payment_charge_id
properties.description: Telegram payment identifier

properties.name: total_amount
properties.description: Total price in the smallest units of the currency (integer, not float/double). For example, for a price of US$ 1.45 pass amount = 145. See the exp parameter in [currencies.json](https://core.telegram.org/web/20230309033341/https://core.telegram.org/bots/payments/currencies.json), it shows the number of digits past the decimal point for each currency (2 for the majority of currencies).

Update.name: Update
Update.description: This [object](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#available-types) represents an incoming update.At most one of the optional parameters can be present in any given update.

properties.name: callback_query
properties.description: Optional. New incoming callback query

properties.name: channel_post
properties.description: Optional. New incoming channel post of any kind - text, photo, sticker, etc.

properties.name: chat_join_request
properties.description: Optional. A request to join the chat has been sent. The bot must have the can_invite_users administrator right in the chat to receive these updates.

properties.name: chat_member
properties.description: Optional. A chat member's status was updated in a chat. The bot must be an administrator in the chat and must explicitly specify “chat_member” in the list of allowed_updates to receive these updates.

properties.name: chosen_inline_result
properties.description: Optional. The result of an [inline](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#inline-mode) query that was chosen by a user and sent to their chat partner. Please see our documentation on the [feedback collecting](https://core.telegram.org/web/20230309033341/https://core.telegram.org/bots/inline#collecting-feedback) for details on how to enable these updates for your bot.

properties.name: edited_channel_post
properties.description: Optional. New version of a channel post that is known to the bot and was edited

properties.name: edited_message
properties.description: Optional. New version of a message that is known to the bot and was edited

properties.name: inline_query
properties.description: Optional. New incoming [inline](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#inline-mode) query

properties.name: message
properties.description: Optional. New incoming message of any kind - text, photo, sticker, etc.

properties.name: my_chat_member
properties.description: Optional. The bot's chat member status was updated in a chat. For private chats, this update is received only when the bot is blocked or unblocked by the user.

properties.name: poll
properties.description: Optional. New poll state. Bots receive only updates about stopped polls and polls, which are sent by the bot

properties.name: poll_answer
properties.description: Optional. A user changed their answer in a non-anonymous poll. Bots receive new votes only in polls that were sent by the bot itself.

properties.name: pre_checkout_query
properties.description: Optional. New incoming pre-checkout query. Contains full information about checkout

properties.name: shipping_query
properties.description: Optional. New incoming shipping query. Only for invoices with flexible price

properties.name: update_id
properties.description: The update's unique identifier. Update identifiers start from a certain positive number and increase sequentially. This ID becomes especially handy if you're using [webhooks](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#setwebhook), since it allows you to ignore repeated updates or to restore the correct update sequence, should they get out of order. If there are no new updates for at least a week, then identifier of the next update will be chosen randomly instead of sequentially.

User.name: User
User.description: This object represents a Telegram user or bot.

properties.name: added_to_attachment_menu
properties.description: Optional. True, if this user added the bot to the attachment menu

properties.name: can_join_groups
properties.description: Optional. True, if the bot can be invited to groups. Returned only in [getMe](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#getme).

properties.name: can_read_all_group_messages
properties.description: Optional. True, if [privacy mode](https://core.telegram.org/web/20230309033341/https://core.telegram.org/bots/features#privacy-mode) is disabled for the bot. Returned only in [getMe](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#getme).

properties.name: first_name
properties.description: User's or bot's first name

properties.name: id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this user or bot. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.

properties.name: is_bot
properties.description: True, if this user is a bot

properties.name: is_premium
properties.description: Optional. True, if this user is a Telegram Premium user

properties.name: language_code
properties.description: Optional. [IETF language tag](https://web.archive.org/web/20230309033341/https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IETF_language_tag) of the user's language

properties.name: last_name
properties.description: Optional. User's or bot's last name

properties.name: supports_inline_queries
properties.description: Optional. True, if the bot supports inline queries. Returned only in [getMe](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#getme).

properties.name: username
properties.description: Optional. User's or bot's username

UserProfilePhotos.name: UserProfilePhotos
UserProfilePhotos.description: This object represent a user's profile pictures.

properties.name: photos
properties.description: Requested profile pictures (in up to 4 sizes each)

properties.name: total_count
properties.description: Total number of profile pictures the target user has

UserShared.name: UserShared
