sendGame.name: sendGame
sendGame.description: Use this method to send a game. On success, the sent [Message](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#message) is returned.

arguments.name: allow_sending_without_reply
arguments.description: Pass True if the message should be sent even if the specified replied-to message is not found

arguments.name: chat_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the target chat

arguments.name: disable_notification
arguments.description: Sends the message [silently](https://web.archive.org/web/20230309033341/https://telegram.org/blog/channels-2-0#silent-messages). Users will receive a notification with no sound.

arguments.name: game_short_name
arguments.description: Short name of the game, serves as the unique identifier for the game. Set up your games via [@BotFather](https://web.archive.org/web/20230309033341/https://t.me/botfather).

arguments.name: message_thread_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the target message thread (topic) of the forum; for forum supergroups only

arguments.name: protect_content
arguments.description: Protects the contents of the sent message from forwarding and saving

arguments.name: reply_markup
arguments.description: A JSON-serialized object for an [inline keyboard](https://core.telegram.org/web/20230309033341/https://core.telegram.org/bots/features#inline-keyboards). If empty, one 'Play game_title' button will be shown. If not empty, the first button must launch the game.

arguments.name: reply_to_message_id
arguments.description: If the message is a reply, ID of the original message

sendInvoice.name: sendInvoice
sendInvoice.description: Use this method to send invoices. On success, the sent [Message](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#message) is returned.

arguments.name: allow_sending_without_reply
arguments.description: Pass True if the message should be sent even if the specified replied-to message is not found

arguments.name: chat_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

arguments.name: currency
arguments.description: Three-letter ISO 4217 currency code, see [more on currencies](https://core.telegram.org/web/20230309033341/https://core.telegram.org/bots/payments#supported-currencies)

arguments.name: description
arguments.description: Product description, 1-255 characters

arguments.name: disable_notification
arguments.description: Sends the message [silently](https://web.archive.org/web/20230309033341/https://telegram.org/blog/channels-2-0#silent-messages). Users will receive a notification with no sound.

arguments.name: is_flexible
arguments.description: Pass True if the final price depends on the shipping method

arguments.name: max_tip_amount
arguments.description: The maximum accepted amount for tips in the smallest units of the currency (integer, not float/double). For example, for a maximum tip of US$ 1.45 pass max_tip_amount = 145. See the exp parameter in [currencies.json](https://core.telegram.org/web/20230309033341/https://core.telegram.org/bots/payments/currencies.json), it shows the number of digits past the decimal point for each currency (2 for the majority of currencies). Defaults to 0

arguments.name: message_thread_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the target message thread (topic) of the forum; for forum supergroups only

arguments.name: need_email
arguments.description: Pass True if you require the user's email address to complete the order

arguments.name: need_name
arguments.description: Pass True if you require the user's full name to complete the order

arguments.name: need_phone_number
arguments.description: Pass True if you require the user's phone number to complete the order

arguments.name: need_shipping_address
arguments.description: Pass True if you require the user's shipping address to complete the order

arguments.name: payload
arguments.description: Bot-defined invoice payload, 1-128 bytes. This will not be displayed to the user, use for your internal processes.

arguments.name: photo_height
arguments.description: Photo height

arguments.name: photo_size
arguments.description: Photo size in bytes

arguments.name: photo_url
arguments.description: URL of the product photo for the invoice. Can be a photo of the goods or a marketing image for a service. People like it better when they see what they are paying for.

arguments.name: photo_width
arguments.description: Photo width

arguments.name: prices
arguments.description: Price breakdown, a JSON-serialized list of components (e.g. product price, tax, discount, delivery cost, delivery tax, bonus, etc.)

arguments.name: protect_content
arguments.description: Protects the contents of the sent message from forwarding and saving

arguments.name: provider_data
arguments.description: JSON-serialized data about the invoice, which will be shared with the payment provider. A detailed description of required fields should be provided by the payment provider.

arguments.name: provider_token
arguments.description: Payment provider token, obtained via [@BotFather](https://web.archive.org/web/20230309033341/https://t.me/botfather)

arguments.name: reply_markup
arguments.description: A JSON-serialized object for an [inline keyboard](https://core.telegram.org/web/20230309033341/https://core.telegram.org/bots/features#inline-keyboards). If empty, one 'Pay total price' button will be shown. If not empty, the first button must be a Pay button.

arguments.name: reply_to_message_id
arguments.description: If the message is a reply, ID of the original message

arguments.name: send_email_to_provider
arguments.description: Pass True if the user's email address should be sent to provider

arguments.name: send_phone_number_to_provider
arguments.description: Pass True if the user's phone number should be sent to provider

arguments.name: start_parameter
arguments.description: Unique deep-linking parameter. If left empty, forwarded copies of the sent message will have a Pay button, allowing multiple users to pay directly from the forwarded message, using the same invoice. If non-empty, forwarded copies of the sent message will have a URL button with a deep link to the bot (instead of a Pay button), with the value used as the start parameter

arguments.name: suggested_tip_amounts
arguments.description: A JSON-serialized array of suggested amounts of tips in the smallest units of the currency (integer, not float/double). At most 4 suggested tip amounts can be specified. The suggested tip amounts must be positive, passed in a strictly increased order and must not exceed max_tip_amount.

arguments.name: title
arguments.description: Product name, 1-32 characters

sendLocation.name: sendLocation
sendLocation.description: Use this method to send point on the map. On success, the sent [Message](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#message) is returned.

arguments.name: allow_sending_without_reply
arguments.description: Pass True if the message should be sent even if the specified replied-to message is not found

arguments.name: heading
arguments.description: For live locations, a direction in which the user is moving, in degrees. Must be between 1 and 360 if specified.

arguments.name: horizontal_accuracy
arguments.description: The radius of uncertainty for the location, measured in meters; 0-1500

arguments.name: latitude
arguments.description: Latitude of the location

arguments.name: live_period
arguments.description: Period in seconds for which the location will be updated (see [Live Locations](https://web.archive.org/web/20230309033341/https://telegram.org/blog/live-locations), should be between 60 and 86400.

arguments.name: longitude
arguments.description: Longitude of the location

arguments.name: message_thread_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the target message thread (topic) of the forum; for forum supergroups only

arguments.name: protect_content
arguments.description: Protects the contents of the sent message from forwarding and saving

arguments.name: proximity_alert_radius
arguments.description: For live locations, a maximum distance for proximity alerts about approaching another chat member, in meters. Must be between 1 and 100000 if specified.

arguments.name: reply_markup
arguments.description: Additional interface options. A JSON-serialized object for an [inline keyboard](https://core.telegram.org/web/20230309033341/https://core.telegram.org/bots/features#inline-keyboards), [custom reply keyboard](https://core.telegram.org/web/20230309033341/https://core.telegram.org/bots/features#keyboards), instructions to remove reply keyboard or to force a reply from the user.

arguments.name: reply_to_message_id
arguments.description: If the message is a reply, ID of the original message

Documents and audio files can be only grouped in an album with messages of the same type. On success, an array of [Messages](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#message) that were sent is returned.

sendMessage.name: sendMessage
sendMessage.description: Use this method to send text messages. On success, the sent [Message](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#message) is returned.

arguments.description: Pass True if the message should be sent even if the specified replied-to message is not found

arguments.name: chat_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

arguments.name: disable_notification
arguments.description: Sends the message [silently](https://web.archive.org/web/20230309033341/https://telegram.org/blog/channels-2-0#silent-messages). Users will receive a notification with no sound.

arguments.name: disable_web_page_preview
arguments.description: Disables link previews for links in this message

arguments.name: entities

arguments.name: message_thread_id

arguments.name: parse_mode
arguments.description: Mode for parsing entities in the message text. See [formatting options](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#formatting-options) for more details.

arguments.name: protect_content
arguments.description: Protects the contents of the sent message from forwarding and saving

arguments.name: reply_markup

A JSON-serialized object for an [inline keyboard](https://core.telegram.org/web/20230309033341/https://core.telegram.org/bots/features#inline-keyboards), [custom reply keyboard](https://core.telegram.org/web/20230309033341/https://core.telegram.org/bots/features#keyboards), instructions to remove reply keyboard or to force a reply from the user.

arguments.name: reply_to_message_id
arguments.description: If the message is a reply, ID of the original message

arguments.name: text
arguments.description: Text of the message to be sent, 1-4096 characters after entities parsing

sendPhoto.name: sendPhoto
sendPhoto.description: Use this method to send photos. On success, the sent [Message](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#message) is returned.

arguments.name: allow_sending_without_reply
arguments.description: Pass True if the message should be sent even if the specified replied-to message is not found

arguments.name: caption

arguments.name: caption_entities

arguments.name: disable_notification

arguments.name: has_spoiler
arguments.description: Pass True if the photo needs to be covered with a spoiler animation

arguments.name: message_thread_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the target message thread (topic) of the forum; for forum supergroups only

arguments.name: parse_mode
arguments.description: Mode for parsing entities in the photo caption. See [formatting options](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#formatting-options) for more details.

arguments.name: photo
arguments.description: Photo to send. Pass a file_id as String to send a photo that exists on the Telegram servers (recommended), pass an HTTP URL as a String for Telegram to get a photo from the Internet, or upload a new photo using multipart/form-data. The photo must be at most 10 MB in size. The photo's width and height must not exceed 10000 in total. Width and height ratio must be at most 20. [More information on Sending Files »](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#sending-files)

arguments.name: protect_content

arguments.name: reply_markup

arguments.name: reply_to_message_id

sendPoll.name: sendPoll
sendPoll.description: Use this method to send a native poll. On success, the sent [Message](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#message) is returned.

arguments.name: allow_sending_without_reply
arguments.description: Pass True if the message should be sent even if the specified replied-to message is not found

arguments.name: allows_multiple_answers
arguments.description: True, if the poll allows multiple answers, ignored for polls in quiz mode, defaults to False

arguments.name: chat_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

arguments.name: close_date
arguments.description: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the poll will be automatically closed. Must be at least 5 and no more than 600 seconds in the future. Can't be used together with open_period.

arguments.name: correct_option_id
arguments.description: 0-based identifier of the correct answer option, required for polls in quiz mode

arguments.name: disable_notification
arguments.description: Sends the message [silently](https://web.archive.org/web/20230309033341/https://telegram.org/blog/channels-2-0#silent-messages). Users will receive a notification with no sound.

arguments.name: explanation
arguments.description: Text that is shown when a user chooses an incorrect answer or taps on the lamp icon in a quiz-style poll, 0-200 characters with at most 2 line feeds after entities parsing

arguments.name: explanation_entities
arguments.description: A JSON-serialized list of special entities that appear in the poll explanation, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

arguments.name: explanation_parse_mode
arguments.description: Mode for parsing entities in the explanation. See [formatting options](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#formatting-options) for more details.

arguments.name: is_anonymous
arguments.description: True, if the poll needs to be anonymous, defaults to True

arguments.name: is_closed
arguments.description: Pass True if the poll needs to be immediately closed. This can be useful for poll preview.

arguments.name: message_thread_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the target message thread (topic) of the forum; for forum supergroups only

arguments.name: open_period
arguments.description: Amount of time in seconds the poll will be active after creation, 5-600. Can't be used together with close_date.

arguments.name: options
arguments.description: A JSON-serialized list of answer options, 2-10 strings 1-100 characters each

arguments.name: protect_content
arguments.description: Protects the contents of the sent message from forwarding and saving

arguments.name: question
arguments.description: Poll question, 1-300 characters

arguments.name: reply_markup
arguments.description: Additional interface options. A JSON-serialized object for an [inline keyboard](https://core.telegram.org/web/20230309033341/https://core.telegram.org/bots/features#inline-keyboards), [custom reply keyboard](https://core.telegram.org/web/20230309033341/https://core.telegram.org/bots/features#keyboards), instructions to remove reply keyboard or to force a reply from the user.

arguments.name: reply_to_message_id
arguments.description: If the message is a reply, ID of the original message

arguments.name: type
arguments.description: Poll type, “quiz” or “regular”, defaults to “regular”

sendSticker.name: sendSticker
sendSticker.description: Use this method to send static .WEBP, [animated](https://web.archive.org/web/20230309033341/https://telegram.org/blog/animated-stickers) .TGS, or [video](https://web.archive.org/web/20230309033341/https://telegram.org/blog/video-stickers-better-reactions) .WEBM stickers. On success, the sent [Message](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#message) is returned.

arguments.name: allow_sending_without_reply
arguments.description: Pass True if the message should be sent even if the specified replied-to message is not found

arguments.name: chat_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

arguments.name: disable_notification
arguments.description: Sends the message [silently](https://web.archive.org/web/20230309033341/https://telegram.org/blog/channels-2-0#silent-messages). Users will receive a notification with no sound.

arguments.name: message_thread_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the target message thread (topic) of the forum; for forum supergroups only

arguments.name: protect_content
arguments.description: Protects the contents of the sent message from forwarding and saving

arguments.name: reply_markup
arguments.description: Additional interface options. A JSON-serialized object for an [inline keyboard](https://core.telegram.org/web/20230309033341/https://core.telegram.org/bots/features#inline-keyboards), [custom reply keyboard](https://core.telegram.org/web/20230309033341/https://core.telegram.org/bots/features#keyboards), instructions to remove reply keyboard or to force a reply from the user.

arguments.name: reply_to_message_id
arguments.description: If the message is a reply, ID of the original message

arguments.name: sticker
arguments.description: Sticker to send. Pass a file_id as String to send a file that exists on the Telegram servers (recommended), pass an HTTP URL as a String for Telegram to get a .WEBP file from the Internet, or upload a new one using multipart/form-data. [More information on Sending Files »](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#sending-files)

sendVenue.name: sendVenue
sendVenue.description: Use this method to send information about a venue. On success, the sent [Message](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#message) is returned.

arguments.name: address
arguments.description: Address of the venue

arguments.name: allow_sending_without_reply
arguments.description: Pass True if the message should be sent even if the specified replied-to message is not found

arguments.name: chat_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

arguments.name: disable_notification
arguments.description: Sends the message [silently](https://web.archive.org/web/20230309033341/https://telegram.org/blog/channels-2-0#silent-messages). Users will receive a notification with no sound.

arguments.name: foursquare_id
arguments.description: Foursquare identifier of the venue

arguments.name: foursquare_type
arguments.description: Foursquare type of the venue, if known. (For example, “arts_entertainment/default”, “arts_entertainment/aquarium” or “food/icecream”.)

arguments.name: google_place_id
arguments.description: Google Places identifier of the venue

arguments.name: google_place_type
arguments.description: Google Places type of the venue. (See [supported types](https://web.archive.org/web/20230309033341/https://developers.google.com/places/web-service/supported_types).)

arguments.name: latitude
arguments.description: Latitude of the venue

arguments.name: longitude
arguments.description: Longitude of the venue

arguments.name: message_thread_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the target message thread (topic) of the forum; for forum supergroups only

arguments.name: protect_content
arguments.description: Protects the contents of the sent message from forwarding and saving

arguments.name: reply_markup
arguments.description: Additional interface options. A JSON-serialized object for an [inline keyboard](https://core.telegram.org/web/20230309033341/https://core.telegram.org/bots/features#inline-keyboards), [custom reply keyboard](https://core.telegram.org/web/20230309033341/https://core.telegram.org/bots/features#keyboards), instructions to remove reply keyboard or to force a reply from the user.

arguments.name: reply_to_message_id
arguments.description: If the message is a reply, ID of the original message

arguments.name: title
arguments.description: Name of the venue

sendVideo.name: sendVideo
sendVideo.description: Use this method to send video files, Telegram clients support MPEG4 videos (other formats may be sent as [Document](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#document)). On success, the sent [Message](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#message) is returned. Bots can currently send video files of up to 50 MB in size, this limit may be changed in the future.

arguments.name: allow_sending_without_reply
arguments.description: Pass True if the message should be sent even if the specified replied-to message is not found

arguments.name: caption
arguments.description: Video caption (may also be used when resending videos by file_id), 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

arguments.name: caption_entities
arguments.description: A JSON-serialized list of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

arguments.name: chat_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

arguments.name: duration
arguments.description: Duration of sent video in seconds

arguments.name: has_spoiler
arguments.description: Pass True if the video needs to be covered with a spoiler animation

arguments.name: height
arguments.description: Video height

arguments.name: message_thread_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the target message thread (topic) of the forum; for forum supergroups only

arguments.name: parse_mode
arguments.description: Mode for parsing entities in the video caption. See [formatting options](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#formatting-options) for more details.

arguments.name: protect_content
arguments.description: Protects the contents of the sent message from forwarding and saving

arguments.description: Additional interface options. A JSON-serialized object for an [inline keyboard](https://core.telegram.org/web/20230309033341/https://core.telegram.org/bots/features#inline-keyboards), [custom reply keyboard](https://core.telegram.org/web/20230309033341/https://core.telegram.org/bots/features#keyboards), instructions to remove reply keyboard or to force a reply from the user.

arguments.name: reply_to_message_id
arguments.description: If the message is a reply, ID of the original message

arguments.name: supports_streaming
arguments.description: Pass True if the uploaded video is suitable for streaming

arguments.name: thumb
arguments.description: Thumbnail of the file sent; can be ignored if thumbnail generation for the file is supported server-side. The thumbnail should be in JPEG format and less than 200 kB in size. A thumbnail's width and height should not exceed 320. Ignored if the file is not uploaded using multipart/form-data. Thumbnails can't be reused and can be only uploaded as a new file, so you can pass “attach://<file_attach_name>” if the thumbnail was uploaded using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name>. [More information on Sending Files »](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#sending-files)

arguments.name: video
arguments.description: Video to send. Pass a file_id as String to send a video that exists on the Telegram servers (recommended), pass an HTTP URL as a String for Telegram to get a video from the Internet, or upload a new video using multipart/form-data. [More information on Sending Files »](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#sending-files)

arguments.name: width
arguments.description: Video width

sendVideoNote.name: sendVideoNote
sendVideoNote.description: As of [v.4.0](https://web.archive.org/web/20230309033341/https://telegram.org/blog/video-messages-and-telescope), Telegram clients support rounded square MPEG4 videos of up to 1 minute long. Use this method to send video messages. On success, the sent [Message](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#message) is returned.

arguments.description: Thumbnail of the file sent; can be ignored if thumbnail generation for the file is supported server-side. The thumbnail should be in JPEG format and less than 200 kB in size. A thumbnail's width and height should not exceed 320. Ignored if the file is not uploaded using multipart/form-data. Thumbnails can't be reused and can be only uploaded as a new file, so you can pass “attach://<file_attach_name>” if the thumbnail was uploaded using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name>. sendVoice.name: sendVoice
sendVoice.description: Use this method to send audio files, if you want Telegram clients to display the file as a playable voice message. For this to work, your audio must be in an .OGG file encoded with OPUS (other formats may be sent as [Audio](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#audio) or [Document](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#document)). On success, the sent [Message](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#message) is returned. Bots can currently send voice messages of up to 50 MB in size, this limit may be changed in the future.

arguments.name: caption

arguments.description: If the message is a reply, ID of the original message

arguments.name: voice
arguments.description: Audio file to send. Pass a file_id as String to send a file that exists on the Telegram servers (recommended), pass an HTTP URL as a String for Telegram to get a file from the Internet, or upload a new one using multipart/form-data. setChatAdministratorCustomTitle.name: setChatAdministratorCustomTitle
setChatAdministratorCustomTitle.description: Use this method to set a custom title for an administrator in a supergroup promoted by the bot. Returns True on success.

arguments.name: chat_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup (in the format @supergroupusername)

arguments.name: custom_title
arguments.description: New custom title for the administrator; 0-16 characters, emoji are not allowed

arguments.name: user_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier of the target user

setChatDescription.name: setChatDescription
setChatDescription.description: Use this method to change the description of a group, a supergroup or a channel. The bot must be an administrator in the chat for this to work and must have the appropriate administrator rights. Returns True on success.

arguments.name: chat_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

arguments.name: description
arguments.description: New chat description, 0-255 characters

setChatMenuButton.name: setChatMenuButton
setChatMenuButton.description: Use this method to change the bot's menu button in a private chat, or the default menu button. Returns True on success.

arguments.name: chat_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the target private chat. If not specified, default bot's menu button will be changed

arguments.name: menu_button
arguments.description: A JSON-serialized object for the bot's new menu button. Defaults to [MenuButtonDefault](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#menubuttondefault)

setChatPermissions.name: setChatPermissions
setChatPermissions.description: Use this method to set default chat permissions for all members. The bot must be an administrator in the group or a supergroup for this to work and must have the can_restrict_members administrator rights. Returns True on success.

arguments.name: chat_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup (in the format @supergroupusername)

arguments.name: permissions
arguments.description: A JSON-serialized object for new default chat permissions

arguments.name: use_independent_chat_permissions
arguments.description: Pass True if chat permissions are set independently. Otherwise, the can_send_other_messages and can_add_web_page_previews permissions will imply the can_send_messages, can_send_audios, can_send_documents, can_send_photos, can_send_videos, can_send_video_notes, and can_send_voice_notes permissions; the can_send_polls permission will imply the can_send_messages permission.

setChatPhoto.name: setChatPhoto
setChatPhoto.description: Use this method to set a new profile photo for the chat. Photos can't be changed for private chats. The bot must be an administrator in the chat for this to work and must have the appropriate administrator rights. Returns True on success.

arguments.name: chat_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

arguments.name: photo
arguments.description: New chat photo, uploaded using multipart/form-data

setChatStickerSet.name: setChatStickerSet
setChatStickerSet.description: Use this method to set a new group sticker set for a supergroup. The bot must be an administrator in the chat for this to work and must have the appropriate administrator rights. Use the field can_set_sticker_set optionally returned in [getChat](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#getchat) requests to check if the bot can use this method. Returns True on success.

arguments.name: chat_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup (in the format @supergroupusername)

arguments.name: sticker_set_name
arguments.description: Name of the sticker set to be set as the group sticker set

setChatTitle.name: setChatTitle
setChatTitle.description: Use this method to change the title of a chat. Titles can't be changed for private chats. The bot must be an administrator in the chat for this to work and must have the appropriate administrator rights. Returns True on success.

arguments.name: chat_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

arguments.name: title
arguments.description: New chat title, 1-128 characters

setGameScore.name: setGameScore
setGameScore.description: Use this method to set the score of the specified user in a game message. On success, if the message is not an inline message, the [Message](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#message) is returned, otherwise True is returned. Returns an error, if the new score is not greater than the user's current score in the chat and force is False.

arguments.name: chat_id
arguments.description: Required if inline_message_id is not specified. Unique identifier for the target chat

arguments.name: disable_edit_message
arguments.description: Pass True if the game message should not be automatically edited to include the current scoreboard

arguments.name: force
arguments.description: Pass True if the high score is allowed to decrease. This can be useful when fixing mistakes or banning cheaters

arguments.name: inline_message_id
arguments.description: Required if chat_id and message_id are not specified. Identifier of the inline message

arguments.name: message_id
arguments.description: Required if inline_message_id is not specified. Identifier of the sent message

arguments.name: score
arguments.description: New score, must be non-negative

arguments.name: user_id
arguments.description: User identifier

setMyCommands.name: setMyCommands
setMyCommands.description: Use this method to change the list of the bot's commands. See [this manual](https://core.telegram.org/web/20230309033341/https://core.telegram.org/bots/features#commands) for more details about bot commands. Returns True on success.

arguments.name: commands
arguments.description: A JSON-serialized list of bot commands to be set as the list of the bot's commands. At most 100 commands can be specified.

arguments.name: language_code
arguments.description: A two-letter ISO 639-1 language code. If empty, commands will be applied to all users from the given scope, for whose language there are no dedicated commands

arguments.name: scope
arguments.description: A JSON-serialized object, describing scope of users for which the commands are relevant. Defaults to [BotCommandScopeDefault](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#botcommandscopedefault).

setMyDefaultAdministratorRights.name: setMyDefaultAdministratorRights
setMyDefaultAdministratorRights.description: Use this method to change the default administrator rights requested by the bot when it's added as an administrator to groups or channels. These rights will be suggested to users, but they are free to modify the list before adding the bot. Returns True on success.

arguments.name: for_channels
arguments.description: Pass True to change the default administrator rights of the bot in channels. Otherwise, the default administrator rights of the bot for groups and supergroups will be changed.

arguments.name: rights
arguments.description: A JSON-serialized object describing new default administrator rights. If not specified, the default administrator rights will be cleared.

setPassportDataErrors.name: setPassportDataErrors
setPassportDataErrors.description:
Informs a user that some of the Telegram Passport elements they provided contains errors. The user will not be able to re-submit their Passport to you until the errors are fixed (the contents of the field for which you returned the error must change). Returns True on success.
Use this if the data submitted by the user doesn't satisfy the standards your service requires for any reason. For example, if a birthday date seems invalid, a submitted document is blurry, a scan shows evidence of tampering, etc. Supply some details in the error message to make sure the user knows how to correct the issues.

arguments.name: errors
arguments.description: A JSON-serialized array describing the errors

arguments.name: user_id
arguments.description: User identifier

setStickerPositionInSet.name: setStickerPositionInSet
setStickerPositionInSet.description: Use this method to move a sticker in a set created by the bot to a specific position. Returns True on success.

arguments.name: position
arguments.description: New sticker position in the set, zero-based

arguments.name: sticker
arguments.description: File identifier of the sticker

setStickerSetThumb.name: setStickerSetThumb
setStickerSetThumb.description: Use this method to set the thumbnail of a sticker set. Animated thumbnails can be set for animated sticker sets only. Video thumbnails can be set only for video sticker sets only. Returns True on success.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: Sticker set name

arguments.name: thumb
arguments.description: A PNG image with the thumbnail, must be up to 128 kilobytes in size and have width and height exactly 100px, or a TGS animation with the thumbnail up to 32 kilobytes in size; see [](https://core.telegram.org/web/20230309033341/https://core.telegram.org/stickers#animated-sticker-requirements)[https://core.telegram.org/stickers#animated-sticker-requirements](https://web.archive.org/web/20230309033341/https://core.telegram.org/stickers#animated-sticker-requirements) for animated sticker technical requirements, or a WEBM video with the thumbnail up to 32 kilobytes in size; see [](https://core.telegram.org/web/20230309033341/https://core.telegram.org/stickers#video-sticker-requirements)[https://core.telegram.org/stickers#video-sticker-requirements](https://web.archive.org/web/20230309033341/https://core.telegram.org/stickers#video-sticker-requirements) for video sticker technical requirements. Pass a file_id as a String to send a file that already exists on the Telegram servers, pass an HTTP URL as a String for Telegram to get a file from the Internet, or upload a new one using multipart/form-data. [More information on Sending Files »](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#sending-files). Animated sticker set thumbnails can't be uploaded via HTTP URL.

arguments.name: user_id
arguments.description: User identifier of the sticker set owner

setWebhook.name: setWebhook
setWebhook.description:
Use this method to specify a URL and receive incoming updates via an outgoing webhook. Whenever there is an update for the bot, we will send an HTTPS POST request to the specified URL, containing a JSON-serialized [Update](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#update). In case of an unsuccessful request, we will give up after a reasonable amount of attempts. Returns True on success.
If you'd like to make sure that the webhook was set by you, you can specify secret data in the parameter secret_token. If specified, the request will contain a header “X-Telegram-Bot-Api-Secret-Token” with the secret token as content.

arguments.name: allowed_updates
arguments.description: A JSON-serialized list of the update types you want your bot to receive. For example, specify [“message”, “edited_channel_post”, “callback_query”] to only receive updates of these types. See [Update](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#update) for a complete list of available update types. Specify an empty list to receive all update types except chat_member (default). If not specified, the previous setting will be used.Please note that this parameter doesn't affect updates created before the call to the setWebhook, so unwanted updates may be received for a short period of time.

arguments.name: certificate
arguments.description: Upload your public key certificate so that the root certificate in use can be checked. See our [self-signed guide](https://core.telegram.org/web/20230309033341/https://core.telegram.org/bots/self-signed) for details.

arguments.name: drop_pending_updates
arguments.description: Pass True to drop all pending updates

arguments.name: ip_address
arguments.description: The fixed IP address which will be used to send webhook requests instead of the IP address resolved through DNS

arguments.name: max_connections
arguments.description: The maximum allowed number of simultaneous HTTPS connections to the webhook for update delivery, 1-100. Defaults to 40. Use lower values to limit the load on your bot's server, and higher values to increase your bot's throughput.

arguments.name: secret_token
arguments.description: A secret token to be sent in a header “X-Telegram-Bot-Api-Secret-Token” in every webhook request, 1-256 characters. Only characters A-Z, a-z, 0-9, _ and - are allowed. The header is useful to ensure that the request comes from a webhook set by you.

arguments.name: url
arguments.description: HTTPS URL to send updates to. Use an empty string to remove webhook integration

stopMessageLiveLocation.name: stopMessageLiveLocation
stopMessageLiveLocation.description: Use this method to stop updating a live location message before live_period expires. On success, if the message is not an inline message, the edited [Message](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#message) is returned, otherwise True is returned.

arguments.name: chat_id
arguments.description: Required if inline_message_id is not specified. Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

arguments.name: inline_message_id
arguments.description: Required if chat_id and message_id are not specified. Identifier of the inline message

arguments.name: message_id
arguments.description: Required if inline_message_id is not specified. Identifier of the message with live location to stop

arguments.name: reply_markup
arguments.description: A JSON-serialized object for a new [inline keyboard](https://core.telegram.org/web/20230309033341/https://core.telegram.org/bots/features#inline-keyboards).

stopPoll.name: stopPoll
stopPoll.description: Use this method to stop a poll which was sent by the bot. On success, the stopped [Poll](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#poll) is returned.

arguments.name: chat_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

arguments.name: message_id
arguments.description: Identifier of the original message with the poll

arguments.name: reply_markup
arguments.description: A JSON-serialized object for a new message [inline keyboard](https://core.telegram.org/web/20230309033341/https://core.telegram.org/bots/features#inline-keyboards).

unbanChatMember.name: unbanChatMember
unbanChatMember.description: Use this method to unban a previously banned user in a supergroup or channel. The user will not return to the group or channel automatically, but will be able to join via link, etc. The bot must be an administrator for this to work. By default, this method guarantees that after the call the user is not a member of the chat, but will be able to join it. So if the user is a member of the chat they will also be removed from the chat. If you don't want this, use the parameter only_if_banned. Returns True on success.

arguments.name: chat_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the target group or username of the target supergroup or channel (in the format @channelusername)

arguments.name: only_if_banned
arguments.description: Do nothing if the user is not banned

arguments.name: user_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier of the target user

unbanChatSenderChat.name: unbanChatSenderChat
unbanChatSenderChat.description: Use this method to unban a previously banned channel chat in a supergroup or channel. The bot must be an administrator for this to work and must have the appropriate administrator rights. Returns True on success.

arguments.name: chat_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

arguments.name: sender_chat_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier of the target sender chat

unhideGeneralForumTopic.name: unhideGeneralForumTopic
unhideGeneralForumTopic.description: Use this method to unhide the 'General' topic in a forum supergroup chat. The bot must be an administrator in the chat for this to work and must have the can_manage_topics administrator rights. Returns True on success.

arguments.name: chat_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup (in the format @supergroupusername)

unpinAllChatMessages.name: unpinAllChatMessages
unpinAllChatMessages.description: Use this method to clear the list of pinned messages in a chat. If the chat is not a private chat, the bot must be an administrator in the chat for this to work and must have the 'can_pin_messages' administrator right in a supergroup or 'can_edit_messages' administrator right in a channel. Returns True on success.

arguments.name: chat_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

unpinAllForumTopicMessages.name: unpinAllForumTopicMessages
unpinAllForumTopicMessages.description: Use this method to clear the list of pinned messages in a forum topic. The bot must be an administrator in the chat for this to work and must have the can_pin_messages administrator right in the supergroup. Returns True on success.

arguments.name: chat_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup (in the format @supergroupusername)

arguments.name: message_thread_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the target message thread of the forum topic

unpinChatMessage.name: unpinChatMessage
unpinChatMessage.description: Use this method to remove a message from the list of pinned messages in a chat. If the chat is not a private chat, the bot must be an administrator in the chat for this to work and must have the 'can_pin_messages' administrator right in a supergroup or 'can_edit_messages' administrator right in a channel. Returns True on success.

arguments.name: chat_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

arguments.name: message_id
arguments.description: Identifier of a message to unpin. If not specified, the most recent pinned message (by sending date) will be unpinned.

uploadStickerFile.name: uploadStickerFile
uploadStickerFile.description: Use this method to upload a .PNG file with a sticker for later use in createNewStickerSet and addStickerToSet methods (can be used multiple times). Returns the uploaded [File](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#file) on success.

arguments.name: png_sticker
arguments.description: PNG image with the sticker, must be up to 512 kilobytes in size, dimensions must not exceed 512px, and either width or height must be exactly 512px. [More information on Sending Files »](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#sending-files)

arguments.name: user_id
arguments.description: User identifier of sticker file owner
